14150936.review:
Cinders is definitely a departure from what you normally find on Steam. A stunning and interesting adaptation of Cinderella, Cinders is a visual novel and Choose Your Own Adventure story that captures, in a grown-up way, the spirit you had and the magic you felt reading as a child. The only two things creating this world are artwork and music, as the dialogue – the heart of the game – is all text. Surprisingly, I did not come across many grammatical errors, and being the English major I am, I was certainly looking. Editors have done quite the job. The storytelling was thoughtful and well-crafted; the writing was intelligent and contained more adult humour than I expected. In the short period of time it took to get through the first playthrough (roughly five hours), the writing delved into the pasts of a few characters and built them up to be more than just one-dimensional. 

Though most of the art is static, the odd flicker of the fireplace, shimmer of water or subtle eye and lip movements somehow bring it entirely to life. Though more colourful and detailed, the artwork does remind me of that which you would find in old hardcover fairytale books. The ambient music is absolutely beautiful and changes with each scene, though because it was the only auditory element it did have me longing for even more variety at times (as the songs are repeated); I wish the soundtrack contained even more. 

Though based on a traditional story with a subdued and passive female protagonist, this modern adaptation takes some unexpected and satisfying departures and shines more light on the complex relationships between the characters and Cinders’ struggle for independence and thirst for freedom. There is a focus on family and the conflicts between taking care of others and taking care of oneself. The heart of the story is finding one’s own path in life and understanding that each choice you make has a consequence, either immediately or in the future, for both yourself and those around you. In this way, the replay value of this game is pretty spectacular: it has four possible endings. And in all honesty, I think I am actually going to play through to see all of them.

If you enjoy reading and visual novels, Cinders is absolutely with a playthrough (or four!).

14116457.review: I LOVE this game! The art style is one of the most beautiful I have seen and the different background scenery is really atmospheric. I love how you can shape Cinders' character through some small actions and the story is a brilliant, mature take on Cinderella. I found it really interesting to see the different characters and hints of their backstory, giving the impression that you don't know whats going on and why they act in a certain way - the characters felt very realistic. I really like the reward system and how it displays it; it was a small touch but I loved it! On the rewards page it also shows you different paths and how much you have completed of each which really makes me want to play this game until I unlock every option it has. So far I have played through the story twice and noticed a few subtle changes in dialogue that made it feel like I was making a new character both times.

14095032.review:
PROS
- Cinders's personality is up to the player via dialogue choices
--> Consistency is rewarded, while random personality choices don't serve as well
- The art is beautiful, from the backgrounds to the characters
- Morality is ambiguous, unlike what you expect from fairy tales
- 4 different endings, all with many variations
- The dialogue flows well and is interesting to follow
- The stepsisters and stepmother are relatable, vulnerable people with real problems
- Branches in the storyline feel like they matter for the events that happen no matter what
- Two different forces of magic can help Cinders for the ball
--> Both have a connection with Cinders's mother and provide different background info respectively
- All the characters have issues to work out, the relationships Cinders makes from the player choices feel like they develop in a realistic way; nothing feels forced, like in the fairy tale
- 3 different goals for Cinders, not just marrying the prince and living happily ever after
- 3 different love interests
- Can re-watch endings and variations after you unlock them, very high replay value
- Skip function for dialogue you have already read
- No tedious stat building!! :)

CONS
- Cinders's name... It's a bit difficult to take a scene seriously sometimes when characters call her "Cinders"
- The game doesn't tell you what personality you have stacked or what progress your relationships are...so sometimes it's hard to know how to progress and confusing if a certain dialogue option doesn't work
--> Leads to lots of trial and error
- Failing to get the variation you want can be a bit frustrating for completionists
- The music isn't too memorable
- No homosexual romances, all 3 love interests are male
- No customization of how Cinders looks
- No voices

This is a wonderful, extensive visual novel and possibly one of the best I've ever played. I've always criticized Cinderella as a character for being one of the most passive protagonists in the history of fairy tales, but in this game you can make her to be the woman you always wanted her to be. She also doesn't always have to marry the prince and sometimes the ending isn't going to be happy. You could even die and have no one mourn over you. The possibilities are vast, giving it lots of replay value. All the art is gorgeous to look at as well so oftentimes I just stop reading and take in the scene.

The developers were right in advertising this game as a "mature" take on the fairy tale, as all the characters are ambiguous. You can never truly figure each of them out and most of the time, they will surprise you. The game does a wonderful job of consistently claiming that no one is so simple as "good" or "evil" and even the kingdom is going through a metamorphosis if you pay attention to the Prince's plot. Speaking of which, the writing is downright brilliant and atmospheric since it is a western visual novel. There are unfortunately no voices, but little nuances in what the characters say give your imagination plenty to give the characters voices of your own.

If you enjoy visual novels with emphasis on dialogue choices, protagonist identity, relationships, and no stat building, definitely buy this game. I hate tedious stat building myself and much prefer making decisions through dialogue. All relationships are accessible provided you have made the choices to develop them; they don't rely on you being "cute" enough or "intelligent" enough. Despite my glowing recommendation however, Cinders is by no means perfect and I eagerly await anything else the developers have building off of this amazing genre.

14064444.review:
Cinders starts off as an interactive version of [i]Cinderella [/i], but quickly gains a large amount of depth. The multituide of different choices and how many different results branch off the beginning are astounding. The art style is lovely and the narrative progresses in an intriguing way. The different characters are each interesting in their own right, and watching the way that they develop and help or hinder you throughout the story is fascinating. 

For some people this sort of game (text-based adventure) could be a little too slow and possibly boring, but this is a prime example of a good T-B-A. It's not overly long (2.5 hours per playthrough depending on your speed and choices), and gives you hints as to how diverse the story could be on multiple playthroughs. This diversity of narrative is suggested through a collection of trophies that correlate to particular plot points that you unlock through role-playing in different ways. I've played through the game twice and have still only unlocked 3 of the 8 possible tropies, and definitely plan on playing through this game a few more times.

4/5 - Would thoroughly recommend to any fans of this genre of game, but also to anyone contemplating trying it.

13986125.review:
Lovely art, above-average writing, some replay value.  

One of the most impressive things that sets this apart from other visual novels (from any country) is the incredible attention to detail.  The fonts, text boxes, and interfaces are attractive and professional-looking; dynamic lighting makes the already-gorgeous backgrounds look even better; and characters' eyes actually move back and forth (although this sometimes can cause character models to veer into "uncanny valley" territory).

My only real complaint is that, on one or two occasions, the parts of a conversation that were affected by my choices and the parts that would have been said regardless (i.e. main plot stuff) did not flow together naturally, making it difficult to determine whether the relationship between my protagonist and a particular character was friendly or hostile.

Still definitely in the upper-tier of visual novels.  If you like VNs, this is a quality product and likely worth your time.

13965904.review:

+The art is good

-It's a book

13939883.review:
I wouldn't say I LOVED this game but I liked it quite a bit so it's enough for a postive review.  

-  The artwork and backgrounds were just stunning.  You could get caught up in just looking at the visuals of this game.  Just wow.  Amazing good.  I wanted to screenshot everything, it was just so beautiful to look at.

- If you take your time, Cinders takes about four or five hours to complete per round.  
- Very fitting soundtrack music.  It's nice and relaxing - which says a lot because I normally have to turn down or turn off the music because of getting annoyed.  I didn't have to in this game. 
- It's a great game to play before bed since it's a visual novel - it's very relaxing and doesn't take a lot of energy to play.  You can just read and make some choices here and there.  
- It's very different from "Disney's Cinderella." It's a complete retelling of the story, so you won't get bored reading it likely and it's fairly decently written - it's entertaining at least and some fun options by the end and cool characters.  They are not completely one-dimensional.

13930939.review: Beautiful art, funny dialogue, choices with real results, interesting characters, and romance! It's short and cute with a little cheese, and I loved it.

13903216.review: Beautiful, Fun, Well done. Interesting replay value. Good interactive fiction, and an interesting variation on the Cinderella theme. one issue is that it could use some copyediting, for spelling and grammar.

13841919.review: Cinders: "It's funny how when we grow up, we start rejecting things we consider childish, only to return to them with great joy" ♥

13837988.review: A pretty good example of a western-styled VN, complete with craft-your-own-ending endings. You can tell that someone worked hard on it because it really shows, and I still can't get over how pretty eveything looks!

13836936.review: An interesting game with some lovely visuals, but if you're unsure about the purchase at all you probably wouldn't get much out of it. Was fine for a while, but I only 100%-ed it so I would get my money's worth.

13809006.review: A beautifully illustrated visual novel with wonderfully clever dialogue which had me laughing to myself not five minutes in.

13799968.review:
Cinders is seriously one of the best visual novels you will ever play. I got sucked into this game and I've absolutely loved it. I have some critical feedback for it, but that by no means negates the magificance of this interactive story.

Pros
+ The writing is definitely the best I've ever encountered in a Steam visual novel. If you're a story-motivated gamer who appreciates a solid piece of high-quality writing, this game will be a breath of fresh air. 
+ Characterization goes above and beyond. No longer do you see the flat, 2-dimensional characters you've come to know from Disney's Cinderella. All the characters, even the "bad" ones, are more than what meets the eye. You also have a hand in tailoring Cinders's personality to your liking, which is fun. Cinders can be passive, manipulative, friendly, sensual, rebellious, responsible, romantic, family-oriented, or murderous... whatever floats your boat.
+ The story gives you a feeling of control, which is imperative for me to enjoy VNs. Your choices *do* make a big difference, even if it seems like they're not really doing anything at first. The choices the story presents you with open up different paths and will give you different endings. Some choices create vastly different outcomes, others give more subtle changes.
+ The artwork is stunning. Not only is it a unique style, but everything from the backgrounds to the characters looks polished and detailed. 
+ The characters are animated beautifully. Their expressions change, their postures change, and even their eyes move! I thought this was a nice touch.
+ The soundtrack creates the perfect ambiance and it is simply exquisite to listen to.

Cons
- It's not that long (I think my first playthrough was maybe 5 hours? but I read fast), especially when you do replays to get achievements and epilogues. A lot of time is spent skipping over scenes during replays because, depending on your choices, it's possible that only a few lines of text will change.
- All relationship stats and personality stats are hidden, so you don't see how your stats are changing when you make choices. This makes it harder to see if you're on track with what you're wanting to do.
- I wish there were more routes that could further deviate from the traditional Cinderella tale. For example, I wish there were options to not go to the ball, to choose no "fairy godmother" to help you, to gang up with your step-sisters to overtake Carmosa, to romance some other unexpected people (the Shady Character maybe? hahaha) or... the possibilities are endless! Basically, even though this game is already amazing, it could have been even cooler if there were some other creative pathways you could take.

Overall, I whole-heartedly recommend this game. It's earned a special place in my heart. Though I can definitely find areas for improvement, this game is too much a great experience to pass up.

13797897.review:
Although this game seems like another Cinderella story, it's actually quite fun and different in it's own way. I am completely enthralled with this game, and I find myself playing it for hours without realizing it. It was worth it to get in the sale though. They have a demo available that you can continue after you buy the game, but it's worth checking out just to try it and see if you are interested!/

Of course the artwork is beautiful on top of that!

13781326.review: By far the most beautiful visual novel I've played.  Worth it for the art alone.  But the rest of the game is also excellent - the story is the right mix of classic and something fresh, the characters have been fleshed out magnificently, and the presentation of the writing is easy to read and feel involved in.

13775150.review:
Such a breathtaking game - the music is lovely, fitting and not irritating, the backgrounds are just beautiful, and the characters are highly detailed and very striking to look at. The dialogue is good - and the choices meaningful. It's a game to simply enjoy - admiring the artwork, the storytelling and the music. 

This is a visual novel - so there is a lot of reading, but no walls of text, all short dialogue that is easily read without feeling like a chore. It's a great introduction to visual novels as the re-telling of Cinderella, it's a story that most will be familiar with - and one that breaks away from the more common Japanese based visual novels which can be a bit heavier going. 

Worth full price, definitely worth grabbing on sale or in a bundle. I can't wait for the next game from this publisher to appear.

13769462.review:
I'm not really a big fan of visual novels, but I genuinely enjoyed this lovely little adaption of the Cinderella fairytale.

The artwork is gorgeous, and the music is lovely. 
And in my opinion it was well-written too. I'm not going to spoiler the story with an elaborate breakdown. Just enjoy the magic of the moment.

Certainly a welcome introduction to visual novels.
And also a good title for the complainers that think visual novels have too much anime. =^)

13767786.review: Now this is the kind of visual novels I love! You get to choose your own personality and make your own choices as you play the game and the characters adjust their attitudes towards you based on your previous choices. It's a very mature and complex version of the Cinderella story. The writer turned the ugly stepsisters and evil stepmother into surprisingly realistic characters. They all have reasons for being the way they are and actually some fairly decent redeeming qualities. You don't end up hating them by the end. The game leaves you really feeling for them and trying to understand what they're going through. My only regret is that the game was not longer and that there aren't more games like this out there. This is the perfect example of my favorite type of games. It has epic artwork and music; good, quality characters and is just wonderful in every aspect. If you like visual novels then I wholeheartedly recommend this game.

13739066.review:
I do not play a lot of visual novels, but I tried Cinders.
And I loved it, why? Well..
First of all, it looks great. You do not just look at pictures, but the backgrounds are moving slightly giving the game a great look. And the characters look good as well.
Next, the characters. They are very well written and react to the choices you made during the game. They can be friends or hate you, your choices matter. And all of them have an agenda of their own. 
The plot. You do know the story, but what if.... Cinderella was trying to run away. Well you can try in the game, it has several endings and your choices come back to you in the endings. Makes you wonder what would happen if you made some other choices. And that is the real strength of the game, you want to play it again to see what would happen if... It is that well written.
Last positive, the fast foreward button. After a playthrough you get access to this. All the dialoge you read before will be skipped, but the game stops if it is new. So after 2 play's you can skip bits of the story to get to the new and interesting part. A great feature.

I do reccomend this game, very much so. If you like stories and choices, pick it up and give it a try.

13732184.review:
[i]btw my steam time-played is wrong[/i]

A fantasy story told through the lens of an adult reality, very interesting. 

In execution Cinders is a model of how [u]visual novels[/u] should be done. Cinders is not much of a choose-your-own-adventure because it is very linear, but your choices do influence most of the dialogue & interactions throughout the game. The multitude of choices leads to large variety in outcomes so you can comfortably do many playthroughs.  The art is nice but somewhat limited (not a big deal), same again for the music.

Not exactly touchpad friendly because the hitbox will sometimes glitch and pick the wrong option. So use a mouse or use the autosave function to immeidately go back one choice when the wrong option is mischosen. 

Recommended when on sale.

13712566.review:
The background art is very pretty, and the story has an interesting 'not everything is black and white' moral - or at least it's interesting until it's been stated over and over and o...ve...zzz

The 'Cinders' script feels much less elegant in comparison with somewhat clunky, repetitive dialogue with reletively few flags.  'Cinders' is not a terrible VN, but please consider your age and life experience before purchasing!

13697861.review: Cinders is like reading a book. I know, princes and medival setting aren't my best friends, so just ignore that fact. The game (as it it) is well written and well-wrought.

13580417.review: This is a brilliant game. Cinders is so different from the typical fairytale, she talks back and is not afraid of telling it like it is. The art work is fantastic and the graphics from the sunlight coming through the window to the dust mites dancing amongst it are very detailed. The characters are really interesting and I loved how you get to sympathise slightly with the step sisters which you would never think of doing! Loved this game so much, thank you!

13578180.review:
I wanted to like this game. A visual novel retelling of Cinderella, with beautiful graphics, the opportunity to come to see the characters in a new light, and a rather rewarding UI innovation that tells you whenever the dialogue snippet you're seeing could have gone differently had you chosen differently at some earlier juncture, making the game feel much more interactive.

Alas, I couldn't, for the game had too many things that broke my immersion. The protagonist, like the classic Cinderella, is supposed to be living in a small medieval village and have been working basically as a servant for her family for the last several years, yet when she speaks to her stepsisters, she sounds as if she had been reading several books worth of modern pop psychology. At one point she even tells one of her stepsisters, "you are the unknown variable in this equation". Just how did she and her stepsister (who seems to understand the expression just fine) have the chance to learn algebra?

Furthermore, although the process of Cinders winning over her stepsisters and allowing us to see them as people who had their reasons for treating Cinders badly could have been an enjoyable subversion of the original story, things seem to happen much too easily. At least with one of the stepsisters, the process starts with a conversation where Cinders basically asks whether the stepsister has considered that it would be nicer for everyone if they could be friends, and the stepsister goes "oh, you're right". (It's been a little while between me playing the game and writing the review, so I might misremember the details slightly, but even if they're a little off, this is still a good characterization of how sensible the conversion came off as.)

I finally stopped playing in a dialogue when a conversation with one of the stepsisters seemed to be going well, but suddenly she started lashing out at me for no reason. That could have been intentional, but it looked more like a bug. Ordinarily that wouldn't have been a game-killer and I could have just gone back to an earlier save to see if I could get around it somehow, but with this game, it was the final straw.

13574610.review: J'ai adoré jouer à ce jeu. Pour ceux qui ont aimé Long Live the Queen: ce n'est pas tout à fait le même principe, mais aussi question de stratégie dans les choix qui nous sont offerts pour terminer le jeu. Les dessins sont superbes et la musique agréable.

13552292.review: I recieved Cinders as a gift, and it has become one of my favorite visual novels of the year. The story follows that of Cinderella in a more mature light. The art and soundtrack is stunningly beautiful. It has an overall touching story, and I found myself able to eventually understand each of the characters despite the limited interactions. I can't possibly say that there are any cons.

13537101.review: Kind of boring. Beautiful art, neat take on humanizing characters; however, never gives much depth or meaning to your choices.

13514056.review:
Been a while since I played an interactive novel for 3 straight hours. And it's worth it. 
The writing is witty and interesting, the choices always give you a moments pause because oh, that one seems like a good idea while that other one will get me where I'm aiming while that third one screams horrid fun.

I like that each complete playthrough adds to the title screen (oh, and achievements obviously but who collects them these days?) which gives me a sense of fulfillment after each playthrough.
And thank the Gods for the skip function or those 3hrs would have been much longer and really all I wanted was Perrault (Still didn't get the ending I wanted but I know where I went wrong and oh gods why did I only save once?)

But yes, multiple endings, each with a little 'and so the story ends' because if there's one thing I appreciate (other than skip functions and swordsmen with way too many belts) it's finding out what happens to the story AFTER I've clicked my way through it amidst giggles.

My one annoyance is the ball scene. The next line is kind of a spoiler, I guess?
Regardless of the choices you make, it doesn't change because Cinders will still dance with His Lordship, who'll flirt and she'll smirk and coo 'tell me more darling' while I sit here wondering if she's forgotten her dear Captain's poetry already.
Maybe if I make more drastic choices it'll change, but I doubt it.

That said, that's honestly an incredibly minor detail (because skip function. I may mention this a lot but have you ever played an interactive novel without one? Don't.) and as above, the writing and endings definitly calls for replays.
Plus I kinda wanna see if I can get the girls on good terms because ho boy would that be an awesome ending (please be an awesome ending)

This is definitly a game I'd recommend to those that enjoy a good story, witty text and a pretty art style.
It's Cinderella, but with more spunk, a good dose of sass and less frolicking vermin.
I should have started with that.

Now if you'll excuse me, I need to go laugh about a well-respected guardsman making odd animal noises in the bushes.

13497434.review: A beautiful branching visual novel that suffers from spotty writing. Cinders is a fairly short but mostly entertaining affair if you go through it once, but the number of paths is commendable and the outcomes can vary quite a lot. The writing does come off as a bit amateurish, and I found myself shouting "NO ONE TALKS LIKE THAT!" to myself on occasion. That said, I would recommend this at around $5 or so.

13424766.review: What a delightful game!  The only virtual novels I have done are the "choose your own adventure" novels for children on Amazon.  I remember these types of books from my childhood where it would have you turn to a certain page.  I must be showing my age LOL! 13379563.review: El artwork está bien, pero en general me parece un juego muy infantil y aburrido. Seguramente habría estado bien tenerlo de pequeña, pero ahora no tiene ningún propósito.

13366029.review:
This is a great visual novel game with multiple endings and a variety of different paths to choose from as you play.

The artwork is gorgeous, both the character designs and particularly the background scenery are very impressive.

The soundtrack is great too with a wide range of pieces that draw out a variety of emotions suited to each scene, from tense moments to quiet peaceful mornings.

The dialog is pretty solid and well written, I've definitely seen a lot worse in these kinds of games. The plot of the story is great, holds a lot of mystery and introduces a variety of interesting and distinct characters. With the varied endings, multiple playthroughs can be drastically different depending on the choices you make.

I've only finished the game once and am on my second playthrough at the time of writing this review, but there are at least 3 possible "romantic interests" for Cinders to end up with that I can see, perhaps more that I have not realized yet.

The dialog choices are interesting because it really feels like you get to shape the kind of personality that Cinders has, whether you choose to make her defiant and rebellious or more meek and complacent, or something in between. There is a lot of variety here and it helps create greater depth and adds to the replayability.

Even if you haven't ever really played visual novel games before, Cinders would be a great choice to break into the genre. It has a lot to offer and does a lot of things well.

13170887.review: With excellent writing, engaging storytelling, gorgeous animation, pretty characters, perplexing decisions, incredible visual Style and great Music, Cinders (based on Cinderella) is everything you could ever want from a visual novel and every Fan of the Genre should try it - 85/100

13131125.review:
Bought this game in a Humble Bundle. It looked different and interesting so gave it a whirl. First thing first this game is very text heavy and to get the most out of the game you should read it. The game has a nice feature where you can speed up the text and skip along to the next bit. Personally I found there was just too much to read and too little to decide Cinder's path throughout the story. There are some interesting characters and the artwork is lovely but I think one playthrough the game will do for me personally.

If you like text based games and fancy reading a nice twist on a classic fairy tale this is worth a look. Otherwise probably best to pass on :)

13097969.review: Cinders' strongest point is the art; it's absolutely breathtaking. There are a couple typos throughout the game, which in my opinion is a huge flaw given that it's a visual novel. Not much replay-ability, though, since the main story line stays more or less the same with slight variations, making it rather repetitive. There are four main endings to unlock (each with its own variants), which personally I wouldn't have the patience to achieve due to repetitiveness. I would still recommend, though, since I thoroughly enjoyed my first play-through, and of course, the game is a wonder to look at.

13075691.review: Animation is gorgeous and the many storylines keep it interesting!

13049580.review: MoaCube* has broken an arm, leg, thigh--heck, let's throw in hands too while we're at it. Praise to the writers in this project. Because of them, my expectations for visual novels have been a little more quenched.  The writing is ridiculously good compared to all visual novels.  Great quotes. A lot of time has been put in each choice point. Most of the time, the "better choice" is not clear or possible-there may be more than one. It's pretty fast pace.  The story quality is on par with Jisei/Kansei/Yousei in that aspect. A bit slow towards the end though. FYI This is NOT a game stressed as a dating sim. Your choices will give you an ending that doesn't really stress on the "person" you are with but rather, your final situation.  Finally, a huge applause to the art, music, and animation (lip/eye movements to background animation).  MoaCube* has really outdone themselves on this project.  A must play.

12823978.review:
First of all, if you aren't into visual novels this isn't for you. But on the otherhand, if you are then i garuntee you will love it if you play it all the way through. 
PROS:
This game has four different main endings each with a couple different epilogues you can get through the choices you make. I've seen some reviews on here that say the choices don't matter, which i have to disagree with. Every visual novel game will have choices that seem meaingless and pointless and may not exactly contribute to the main story, but they are there to give you a sense of control. Other choices will be vitally important like the first choice you make. It can change the whole story depending on what you choose. Some people are bothered by no voices or terrible music or any other thing that falls under that category, these people will be so pleased with the musical choice the creators went with. It is beautiful and one of my favorite soundtracks of any game i have ever played. It makes the game 10x better in my opinion. Like i said before, there are four main endings each with their own epilogues; if you are one of those gamers that like to get all they can in a game but hesitates because it takes too long, you will be pleased to find that you can skip through all the dialogue so it makes the replay value go up. Another thing to add would be the artwork for this game. It is amazingly beautiful. Most visual novels have static(stay still) artwork that changes when you move forward in the conversation, but this game has dynamic artwork that moves. Granted it is not much but fires flicker, and dust particles in the sunlight are visible. 
CONS:
Saying all this, there are some faults. Not many, but they are there. Some characters seem useless and very unnatural along with some situations. Sometimes the words lag behind if you are running something in the background. There, that's all the cons in my opinion. Time for the assessment.
ASSESSMENT:
Story: 8
Replay Value: 10 
Music: 10 
Characters: 8
Artwork: 10
OVERALL: 9.1
If you like visual novels, you will thoroughly enjoy this game.

12745421.review: So many paths to take that I haven't discovered yet, but I can't WAIT to do so. One of the most solid VNs I've ever played.

12736685.review:
I thoroughly enjoyed this game — although it would perhaps more accurately be described as a 'choose your own adventure' novel, of the kind I loved when I was a child. You are given enough choice to influence the game and feel as though you have control over your own fate, but not so many choices as to make each individual choice feel meaningless or to ruin the narrative structure.

After finishing it the first time, I loaded a little while back and tried to try out some other choices, and was initially very disappointed — it felt that no matter what I chose, there were very few endings open to me, and they were virtually identical. It wasn't until I started again from the beginning that I realised this wasn't because my choices were meaningless, but because all my previous choices and developed the world in such a way that those outcomes were the only realistic consequences of the character I constructed in the situation I placed her in.

On the whole, if you don't like Virtual Novels, you won't like this one. If you're looking for something a bit more 'gamey', like Long Live the Queen, this will probably be too simplistic for you. But if you like reading, even if you were never into 'choose your own adventure' stories, this is probably worth picking up.

Game-play aside, the game is ~gorgeous~ and the music lovely. Several of the backgrounds are in my desktop wallpaper rotation they're that pretty.

12721907.review: If you like visual novels, this is a game for you. I don't really enjoy them, but I did enjoy this game.. I would imagine this game being more for girls.

12594655.review: A different take on the Cinderella story, Cinders is a beautiful visual novel with interesting choices and character development. The game is about 5 hours long and it was fun trying to get the other endings after finishing it for the first time.

12563360.review:
Pros:
Art 
Music
General plot

Cons:
A LOT of redundant dialogue, the developers of this game clearly made some unflattering assumptions about their players intelligence. ex. Cinder witnesses two characters talking, then one leaves, Cinder asks the remaining character what they were talking about, remaining character then rehashes the conversation you just read.  It's painful and you start pressing enter rapidly to move to the next scene.
Mouth animation that doesn't fit with the otherwise wonderful character art.
Every single character in the entire game will lecture you more than once on the evils of making assumptions and stereotyping people.  

It is my suspicion that the developer wants you to play Cinder while subverting all the tropes of the Cinderella fairy tale.  I chose options that were more in line with the original story for the first play through, could be why almost every conversation I experienced contained a lecture on stereotypes, but it felt very heavy handed and preachy.

12398746.review:
这是一款相当出色的视觉小说/文字冒险游戏，对于著名童话灰姑娘的另类解读

故事基于大家最为熟悉的夏尔·佩罗版本童话，但本作改编后的故事更贴近现实主义风格，试图对每个角色进行深入刻画，而非童话中那么单薄和脸谱化，基于这一核心理念的改编非常有意思，让过去那种幻想式的展开变得合理了很多

机遇总是垂青于有准备的人，在这个解读中，灰姑娘不再是那个单纯、勤劳、善良的小女孩，傻傻等待超自然力量来把自己从悲惨的命运中解救出来，而是一个非常聪慧且果断的角色，处心积虑设法改善自己的处境，根据玩家的选择有些时候甚至到了冷酷无情的地步，乃至可以下毒谋杀继母；仙女对灰姑娘的帮助绝非偶然，不过灰姑娘即便不依靠仙女这种不靠谱的超自然力量也可以达成她的计划

与此同时，过去的反派则被彻底洗白了，继母虽然和经典版一样不通人情，但她所做的一切只是为了独自支撑起这个没落的贵族家庭，选择花重金去参加王子的招亲舞会也是无可奈何的绝望之举，而她的两个女儿在她的高压管教下也变得有些扭曲；大姐为了满足母亲的期望而活的非常拘束，可惜无论如何也无法让母亲满意，最为成熟的她看到无法理解母亲苦心的二姐和灰姑娘自然没个好脸色；二姐因为不断被母亲和大姐责骂而变得愤世嫉俗，虽然本性不坏，但在高压下也只好拿灰姑娘出气，而她实际上是全作最具洞察力的角色，很早就注意到灰姑娘在密谋些什么……

因为本作是一个文字冒险游戏，和其他作品一样玩家会遇到很多选项，主要会对人际关系和结局分支造成影响——于是灰姑娘在玩家的抉择下可以和继母和解，可以和两个姐姐成为好朋友，慢慢解决这个家庭中的问题，看到这样的展开其实比她俘获王子成为王后要更加让我感到欣慰，何况她即便成为王后也可能给王子带绿帽子（除了王子以外，游戏中还有幼驯染商人和守卫队长两个情人候选）

不过无论玩家怎么选择，对主线的推进影响其实都不大，灰姑娘最后都会去盛装参加舞会并给王子留下深刻的印象，能达成的结局一共四大类，但其中根据人际关系和事件触发又会有很多分支结局的排列组合，大家可以更具喜好慢慢探索

虽然作画和音乐都非常优秀，动态画面看起来也十分华丽，但这一浮夸的引擎同时也导致了回滚/快进的低效率（但愿不是我渣配置的错），加上快进在场景更换时会被暂停，非常恼人，严重打压玩家去尝试更多结局的积极性；除了引擎问题以外，CG不足、没有语音、分支事件过少也比较让人遗憾

虽然系统上有些瑕疵，但故事让我非常满意，总体上也算是不可多得的优秀中短篇视觉小说，喜欢这一类型的玩家请不要错过

12390550.review:
"Les jeux dont vous êtes le héros"

Je ne sais pas si vous connaissez la collection de bouquins "Les livres dont vous êtes le héros" (ne cherchez pas en librairie, ça n'est plus édité).
Pour résumer, imaginez un livre normal, mais à de nombreux points de l'histoire, on donne le choix au lecteur entre plusieurs embranchements (attaquer ou pas un ennemi, tourner à droite ou à gauche,...).
"Cinders" est un peu l'équivalent sous forme de jeu vidéo, sauf que les choix concernent les dialogues avec les protagonistes plutôt que des actions.
Autant le dire tout de suite, je préfère lire un livre de poche tranquille dans mon fauteuil que devant un écran (même sur tablette).

En fait, je ne souhaite pas parler de ce jeu en particulier, mais évoquer le mécanisme assez courant dans les jeux vidéos consistant à laisser des choix au joueur, qui sont censés faire changer beaucoup de choses dans l'histoire et l'univers du jeu.

Concrètement, je n'ai pas beaucoup d'exemples qui me viennent en tête, à part une mission de GTA 4 où on fait exploser une station essence (qui reste explosée par la suite), et l'exemple le plus fameux de Fallout 3 et la bombe atomique :)
Après, on rencontre un certain nombre de cas plus ou moins réussis :
- appréciation des PNJ à votre égard (factions dans Stalker, selon votre 'race' dans Masquerade, selon l'alignement dans Baldur's Gate)
- dialogues disponibles en fonction des réponses qu'on donne
- missions de classe
- dans les jeux d'action, possibilité d'infiltration, qui se transforme en shoot si on se fait repérer
- dans Knights of the Old Republic, les choix peuvent faire basculer le personnage du côté obscur de la force (avec changement d'apparence)

En général, on suit une ligne directrice, qui se sépare parfois en plusieurs embranchements.
On choisit un des embranchements (avec rarement possibilité de retour en arrière), et ainsi de suite jusqu'à arriver à la fin du jeu.
Au final, on passe par quelques morceaux d'histoire uniques, avec éventuellement plusieurs fin possibles, mais le plus gros de l'histoire est commun, quels que soient les choix effectués.

Pour bien se rendre compte des différences selon les choix, on doit recommencer le jeu en prenant d'autres décisions (en espérant qu'elles aient un impact différent, ce qui n'est pas gagné).

En résumé, je trouve que le principe n'est pas assez exploité (y compris dans Cinders). Il faudrait que l'univers dans lequel on évolue dans les jeux soit plus modelable, avec des décisions qui impactent réellement l'environnement.
C'est à dire pas seulement changer l'opinion des PNJ ou débloquer une fin alternative, mais voir aussi des changements moins évidents ou plus radicaux, par exemple :
- la destruction d'un commerce important qui reconditionne l'économie
- on répand une matière toxique dans un quartier, ce qui transforme les habitants du coin en mutants et crée une zone de quarantaine
- on peut même imaginer des interactions multijoueurs (ou plutôt entre 2 sessions solo), où l'action d'un joueur impacte d'autres joueurs

Enfin bref, quand on essaie de me vendre un jeu en vantant le fait que mes choix vont tout chambouler, je flaire la plupart du temps l'argument marketing, et malgré son status d'indé, ce jeu ne fait pas exception, je suis déçu, une fois de plus.

12368804.review:
Finally, I finished Cinders,.. so surprise for the ending.. it's too real and too close to player's personality.. such a great game indeed, a lot of options and endings,.. Not like the old way of fairy tales, we can choose to be the cinders we truly are.

12310916.review:
作为一款文字类游戏，这款游戏让我见识到了文字类游戏剧情强大的好处（我玩的文字类游戏不多...）。

陆陆续续玩了这么久，也总算是玩到一个结局了（原谅我阅读速度太慢）。从我打到的结局来看，这款游戏虽然说的还是灰姑娘那样的故事，但是各种人物的性格、心理都更加细腻了。你将看到后妈与灰姑娘的两个后姐妹之间的矛盾、灰姑娘与两姐妹的关系也不是全然对立以及仙女为什么要帮助灰姑娘，等等等很多细枝末节的事情，而且灰姑娘也并非童话、动画里那么天真善良...这对于剧情当来说当然是极好的了！

相对于原版故事，这款游戏的各方面内容都更加深入，一部分是由于篇幅的原因，另一部分制作组的用心也功不可没。像我这种没啥耐心的居然也一玩到底，拒绝+1了，好事啊！

音乐好听但是有些重复，有时想关掉。画面嘛.......看个人喜好吧。

12273628.review: An interesting take on Cinderella in the form of a modern choose-your-own-adventure. I've only played through it once so far, but there's so many paths and rewards to collect that you could easily spend dozens of hours exploring the whole story.

12238420.review:
Played it more than I should have, tried out different outcomes and was more than pleased.
A really decent example of non-linear storytelling. 
While the barbie-like aesthetics do take some getting used to and are unnerving at first, the music does add a great deal to the whole fairy-tale atmosphere and the characters do the make the experience a compelling one.

12237024.review: I admit I'm new to the visual novel scene, but as a starting point, I found Cinders to be very satisfying. The art is gorgeous (especially backgrounds!) and chock full of effects. It also makes me happy that the relationships between the female characters are the crux of the story - the stepmother and Cinder's sisters are complex characters, neither good nor evil; Cinder's behavior towards them brings out other sides to them, and lead to different futures. It also pleased me that the endings aren't entirely depended on whom Cinders falls in love with - they're about her choices for her future and who she wants to be in life. A hot guy can come along if he wants, sure. But Cinders is more than just a vehicle for player romance, she's a young woman looking for her path in life, for better or for worse. It was a pleasurable experience with lovely visuals, and I'm really looking forward to the team's next game, which looks like it will be even better.

12233915.review:
Cinders takes a classic fairytale and returns it with a much darker, more entertaining twist. You /could/ be sweet and marry the prince, or your choices could take you down an entirely different path. The endings all have variables, so who helps you get to the ball, who you decide to pursue as a love interest, or various other factors on Cinders all affect the ending you see. As a personal note one think I love about the game is that the romance isn't necessarily the focus. Instead the focus is how Cinders decides to take control of her life and change it. You could do that via romance, or you could do something else.

None of the characters are just stock characters. They're all developed and have real personalities and reasons for acting the way they do. Even Cinders has a base personality that you affect and develop through your choices, but she never feels like a blank slate. If ever there was a visual novel where the choices matter, it's this one, a fitting trait given the focus of the game.

Other factors about the game feel obvious. The art's gorgeous, even more so than the screenshots suggest. There are subtle movements in the background to enjoy that give Cinders that magical feel fairytales ought to have. Cinders is well written and well developed. Any fan of visual novels should pick this one up, and if you're interested in the genre this is definitely the game to start with.

12193334.review: This is a [gorgeous] visual novel about making choices. That may sound self-evident, since all one does in a visual novel is make choices, but I am talking about the kind of choices people make in real life. There are no good or evil characters in this story; just people with problems that have no clear or "best" solutions. 12162011.review:
I can say this game was a  treat to play. It takes the story of Cinderella and puts more control for Cinderella's character (in this case Cinders) to make her own way. It even allows a bad ending if you play extremely Genre blind. It is a visual novel and reads like some classic literature where there are long dialogues that are more banter than plot advancement, which may not appeal to some.

That said, the art and music is positively beautiful and it does a good job of making characters attractive without overly sexifying them. Though I do wish that Cinders would fucking stand up straight. Which does not really matter except for certain late game events where her posture hurts the effect she's supposed to have. It does suit the early parts of the story and is positively nitpicking on my part.

There is some discussion on whether the game really promotes independence, as a lot of the independence options are tracked as evil or morally questionable. This is a legit complaint, but I question if it's to fit the time period rather than our own sense of values.

Anywho, good game.

12113582.review:
Definitely recommend this! 10/10

+ Amazing story-line that takes a mature & dark spin on the fairytale (and mockingly refers to it sometimes)
+ very worthwhile, thought-provoking dialogue to read through 
+ MANY variations, so there's a lot of re-play value
+ I really like the option to press "ctrl" in order to Fast Forward through dialogue that you already have read (assuming you're doing a second playthrough) - best of all, it stops exactly where the new dialogue begins (assuming you made different choices), very handy and helps you not be bored by multiple playthroughs!

- a few spelling/grammar errors but MoaCube is aware of that and cataloguing these mistakes 
 [url=http://steamcommunity.com/app/293680/discussions/0/540740500553344028/] here. [/url]

12109988.review:
Would have liked this to be a first chapter, but, as it stands, Cinder's world and the plots in it expand quickly and end abruptly. Wish i spent the time reading Grimm's fairy tales instead, but Cinders is a pleasant experience, if short. Most of what's developing throughout gameplay is not personal relationships so much as personal characteristics. This investment in the character feels refreshing and rewarding, a polishing of what may be understood about the choises made available in-game.

A solid entry in a genre that needs more fluidity in the way it divies out dialogue in order to entertain a player who likes to read books as well as play games. 

An RPG on rails with 120 minutes of plot and multiple endings that stretch out to another 120 minutes of text, made simple to explore by a plot-jumping interface that this player did not find rewarding enough to dive into.

Play a game where your choices build a character you adore while trying your hardest to kill her off because you're going to love her too much at the end of its incredibly short playthrough to enjoy any of the other endings.

12102291.review:
Cinders, die Geschichte von Aschenputtel (Cinderella), in der ihr durch eure eigenen Entscheidungen das Ende beeinflussen könnt. Nebenbei erfahrt ihr etwas über die Beweggründe der anderen Figuren. 

[b]PRO[/b]
+ Skip-Button bei bereits gesehenen Szenen! Das erleichtert das erneute spielen für die Alternativen Enden sehr.
+ Wunderschöne Grafik
+ Ein paar kleine Animationen der Figur und vom Hintergrund
+ Alternative Enden
+ Symbol in der Ecke zeigt an, an welchen Punkten die Geschichte auch anders verlaufen könnte.
+ Passende Musik
+ 8 Speicherslots
+ 8 freischaltbare Achievements
+ Hauptmenü verändert sich und zeigt die bisherigen Errungenschaften.

[b]CONTRA[/b]
- Nach ca. 3 Stunden mehrere alternative Enden durchgespielt und alle Erungenschaften erreicht. Aber es gibt noch immer weitere Alternativenden. Dennoch fühlt sich das Spiel an sich irgendwie etwas kurz an.
- Wenn die Figuren aus den Bild verschwinden, scheint manchmal der Hintergrund durch die Augen durch. 

[b]NEUTRAL[/b]
o Leider nur auf Englisch
o Nachdem man alle Errungenschaften hat, gibt es keinen Wiederspielwert mehr.

[b]FAZIT[/b]
Ich habe das Spiel in einen Bundle bekommen und für den Preis war es sehr gut. Das Spiel ist schön gestaltet und bietet Visual Novel Fans ein optisch sehr schönes Stück in der Spielesammlung. Ansonsten spielt es sich wie jedes andere Spiel dieser Art. Für Liebhaber von Spielen dieser Art lohnt es sich jedoch das Spiel in einen Sale zu holen.

12099481.review: This is an excellent choose-your-own-adventure style novel-game. There is nothing I dislike about this game. The artwork is beautiful & the music is fitting. There are a variety of endings, all of which are well-thought out. The script is excellent & often very funny. The game centres around understanding people's motivations & understanding their deeper character. Brilliant game & completely addictive!

12040829.review: As far as visual novels go, I have to say that CINDERS is my favorite, thus far.  The game takes the player down a very mature path within a classic children's fairytale.  The player has complete control over the decision making process of the main character.  Thus, with each choice the player makes for Cinders, her personality changes as the game progresses.  There is a large number of outcomes for this character based on those decisions she is presented with throughout the game.  For instance, with the decisions the player chooses for Cinders, she could become very evil or good, very sexual or timid, and/or anywhere in between.  I honestly couldn't believe the number of outcomes this game presents the player with!  The replayability is enormous.  The artwork is absolutely gorgeous.  The music is beautiful.  I applaud how the devs implemented the 'fast forward scene' ability within the game as even though this is a VN, thus a lot of reading, it allows the player to choose whether to read through a scene over and over if they wish OR fast forward through a scene that they have previously experienced.  Please remember, there are NUMEROUS outcomes to this game and over 300 different possible decisions to be made (at minimum)!  The player can also choose the rate of speed that the dialogue is presented, which gives the player a chance to choose either the slower paced dialogue which visually allows 'emphasis' placed on certain words or phrases 'spoken' by each character OR to speed it up and read at the players pace.  I literally just finished the very last outcome for this game before writing this review.  I sat back and just said "WOW!"  (yes, it's that good!)  I highly recommend this game to any VN lover --- and would really like to see others at least give it a shot.  It truly is a very well thought out game!!!

12020699.review:
If you are here because of the RPG tag then best move on as this game have nothing what differs a RPG from a Adventure.
Cinders is a pure Vissual Novel with nice graphics but if you expect some kind of character system as some other VN have then there is nothing.
The RPG flag was for me the main reason to upvote this game in greenlight but if developer consider games that have some choices that influence the ending already as RPG then over 50% of all games can be considered be a RPG.

12008640.review:
A very nice surprise and my favorite from the Humble Eye Candy Bundle, and eye candy it is, with gorgeous artwork, enhanced with animation and visual effects timed with story events. The music is wonderful, with synchronized changes and leitmotif cues.

I'm new to visual novels, and the concept and writing drew me in. Choices are presented frequently and sensibly enough, with a flower appearing in the top-right corner to note when your choice impacted your playthrough outcome. The nonlinearity of the choices provides multiple interesting paths to four basic outcomes with multiple permutations based on your relationships with other characters, as well as your protagonist's personality. Subsequent playthroughs are easy, as dialogue can be skipped (super fast-forward), automatically stopping at new dialogue or choices.

The writing is generally solid and engaging, with very few spots that are slightly clunky but easily forgivable. Character development is deep for the four women, and amusingly and probably intentionally, the supporting cast of men are somewhat one-dimensional. The concept of a reimagined Cinderella itself is quite fun and more contemporary with an emphasis on female protagonist agency, with some very helpful friends to retain the fanciful nature of the original story.

If you're new to visual novels but like things like Joe Dever's Lone Wolf saga, RPGs with deep character development, and Telltale's Walking Dead series, and consider the possibility that games can be art, you would probably enjoy this.

Quite well-written, beautiful, and with multiple endings for great replay value. Sometimes the dialogue is stilted where it shouldn't be, but for the most part it's funny and full of character. And as a bonus, your choices feel like they really matter, with visual feedback when you change the story in some way.

11897022.review:
Графическая новелла (виртуальный роман), в которой полностью раскрывается сказка о Золушке. Каждый из персонажей (мачеха, сёстры, принц, ведьма и другие) не так прост, как может показаться, все они имеют собственный характер, ценности, стремления. На каждого можно повлиять по ходу действия - и рассказать таким образом свою практически уникальную историю (учитывая массу вариантов каждого из четырёх возможных финалов). 

Помимо поразительного внешнего вида в игре есть хорошая музыка, любовно отточенные, настраиваемые графические и текстовые эффекты, увлекательные диалоги с робко проскальзывающими шуточками. В любой момент (в т.ч. на развилках сюжета) повествование можно сохранить и позже попробовать повернуть события в другое русло. 

На всё про всё у меня ушло шесть часов, и единственным недостатком могу назвать отстутствие перевода на русский язык. Ну и пара вариантов окончания мне показались несколько натянутыми (зато другой потряс своей глубиной).

11886600.review: There are many things to like about this game, and not much to find fault with. There is a lot of text to read, but the pacing is very nice, and is written like an interesting book. The illustration is fantastic; the artist makes stunningly attractive people which make the game very very easy on the eyes. The story is familiar, but has enough of a spin to keep it fresh. There is not action, per se, but there is drama. Enjoyed it, and I intend on re-visiting it so that I can explore some alternate endings. The only complaint I can find with this game at this moment is the price. at a $20 usd price point, it does not present a good value. [ 7 / 10 ]

11841939.review: Cinders is a choose-your-own-adventure style "game" (an interactive novel) based on the story of Cinderella.  It is fairly well written and manages to take the classic characters and make them seem like actual people with depth and complexity.  The protagonist Cinders is not simply a victim for the reader to root for as the story lifts her out of her misery to make her live happily ever after and the "evil stepmother" is pitiable and puts up a good argument for her actions as is the case with the stepsisters.  I've only gone through one variation of the story but there seems to be about 16 endings.  I really enjoyed it for the interesting choices and how the characters' motivations clashed without devolving into a struggle of good vs. evil.

11825847.review:
I adore this game.  It's a beautifully illustrated interactive storybook rather than a traditional game.  I should mention that I purchased it directly from Moa when it was first released and they kindly gave me a Steam key when it was released on Steam.  

The story is a familiar one: you are Cinderella and you have to decide how the events play out.  How will she/you react to your stepmother's machinations?  Will you tell her off or be meek?  Do you love the prince for himself or do you just want to increase your social stature?  Do you fall in love with a childhood friend instead of the prince?  Do you choose no one at all?

The graphics are flat-out gorgeous.  The art is lush, vibrant, and full of life.  Replayability is high due to the vast number of choices you can make.  I've finished one playthrough and am currently playing again to try some of the other options.  In the original version I had some issues with crashing and saves not actually saving and in one instance I had to completely restart, but these issues seem to have been fixed in the Steam version as I have not experienced any crashing/lockups/etc.

Take a look at the screenshots and if you're even remotely intrigued, get this game.  You won't be disappointed.

11791635.review: Cinders ist ein "Spiel", das einen wirklich gefangen nimmt. Absolut spielenswert! Eine bezaubernde Geschichte in einem sehr kunstvollen Umfeld. Hat mir viele schöne Stunden beschert. Außerdem gibt es verschiedene Enden. Ich fand es sehr aufregend zu sehen, wie meine Entscheidungen den Spielverlauf ändern. Sein Geld ist es auf jeden Fall wert!

11773074.review:
Despite the idea and the setting, Cinders is NOT a fairytale story about mistreated girl getting her happy love ending  with the help of fairy godmother. Sure, there is a fairy, there is a ball, there is a Prince, there is a lost slipper (altough it's not a glass one, and she didn't really lose it...).

What you get here instead, is a story about dealing with your broken family. Both, your Stepmother and your Stepsisters have developed troubled personalities hidden under masks of the roles they trying (or are simply forced) to fullfil, and it's up to you to chose what kind of "happy ending" do you want to get, not only for yourself, but also for your family. Will you try to work things out together and help them develop? Or will you destroy them, to get what you want? Or maybe you'll run away from everything and search for your Happy Ending somewhere else? Or maybe you'll become someone you used to despised yourself? Even though the story is set in stricte fairytale world, it portrays MODERN issues of many dysfunctional families out there. And that I find the biggest attraction of this game, along with very beautiful aesthetics. 

On the downside... The game felt like it lacked some more individual panels to look at (as this is what the gameplay is all about- to look at lovely pictures and read a story you can influence with the choices of your own ). Possible romance options could have been developed much further ( 'cmon! You give us 3 handsome dudes and make us lick the window instead of touching the shinies >.< ! ). And unfortunately,  there is no voice-acting, at all. All this makes me feel that 15,99€ is way to expensive for the content it offers. Even though, I still give Cinders thumbs up \o/.

11751018.review:
This is a tricky game to write a review for. I'm not giving a thumbs down because I believe this is a terrible game. I give it a thumbs down because I don't feel a lot of people would enjoy it and as such, I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. Personally, I had quite a bit of fun playing this.

As a kid, I got the least-involved RPGs called Choose Your Own Adventure. You basically read a book and at the end of a page there will be a decision and another and so on and so forth until you have 20+ different endings. This game is basically that with some very pretty drawings to boot.

11748642.review: It's an interactive story, but with less choices than a Choos-Your-Own-Adventure novel. Not to be sexist, but females should love this game. My wife enjoys the artwork, and the interactive story. The many plot branches gives the game a lot of replayability.

11708403.review: If you enjoy a visual novel style game, this modern update on the story of Cinderella will delight and amuse. With a great sense of humor, the writing references numerous fairy tales and pokes fun at their tropes. The eponymous character, Cinders, is interesting, witty, and strong, no matter whether you choose to make her choose a more naive path or one taking a great deal more effort and self reliance. The romance element is nicely worked in such that you can entirely avoid having it be a big part of Cinders' life and future, or you can carry on multiple affairs at once, allowing them to shape that future. Although it was nice to see the "evil" stepsisters represented as a bit less two-dimensional, I can't help but feel an opportunity was lost in not giving them more of a role in the story. It would have been great to see endings in which Cinders assists one or both of the sisters in acheiving their goals. On the whole, though, a solid game with some replay value, especially if you save at key turning points in the story so you don't have to go back to the very beginning each time.

11704973.review:
It's rather unusual to see a visual novel coming from somewhere other than Japan that doesn't attempt to merely emulate those that do, but instead takes hold of the genre and carves a unique path for itself that shows VNs have a lot more to offer than we've thus seen. In the case of Cinders, it also manages to update a classic fairytail into a far more mature and modern story, turning Cinderella into a newly captivating adventurer that eschews many of the originals childish elements for mystery and intrigue. It stumbles a bit along the way, as if walking in its own pair of undersized glass slippers, but on the whole amounts to something unexpectedly enthralling and maybe just a bit magical.

I can't imagine anyone is unfamiliar with the story of Cinderella, so I'll skip the introductions. The vile mother and sisters, sad girl living as a servant waiting for the world to change, glass slippers and prince charming are all here as you'd expect, but where Cinders differs is in taking a simple fairy tail and turning it into a mature and intriguing story that is wildly different than how you remember it. Character interactions are full of personal dialogue and emotion, turning the original cliches into actual people you can relate and empathize with. Cinders sisters might be cold, but once their reasons are explained it's hard not to feel sorry for them despite their cruelties. The prince may appear to live a life of carefree amusement, but on the inside his constant questioning of his actions is tearing him apart and making him question his own motives. There are certainly moments when it becomes overly self indulgent with some of its writing, and a few endings feel a bit hollow (though that's to be expected with how many there are), but these moments are overshadowed by the majority of the dialog, which is hugely engrossing and when compiled with the element of your own choices becomes even more compelling, as you shape the outcome to any number of different paths.

Which brings me to one of the few areas Cinders slips up a bit, at least in the view of someone who wishes to see more than the one ending they arrive at. Throughout the story (which should take you around 2-5 hours depending on your reading speed) you encounter a myriad of choices which change the story and eventually decide your characters fate. The issue arises in the sheer number of decisions that can have an impact on the ending, and the very limited number of saves you are given, which means you are required to skip through huge amounts of text again and again as you reload and make minor alterations to your choices in the attempts to see a new ending. It all becomes greatly repetitive and takes far more time than it otherwise might had you been given more freedom in the number of saves you have, as well as making it quicker to skip through dialog you've already read before.

But ultimately it's a somewhat inconsequential complaint as for those not obsessed with seeing every ending, the first run through the story isn't the least bit affected and just as captivating as ever. Least I forget Cinders is also remarkably pretty to look at, with fantastic art and a ton of minor details bringing the picture to life, from background objects to character expressions. It's a bold new direction for visual novels, a genre that's been stagnant and underrepresented outside of Japan for a long time, and a brilliant first attempt by developer MoaCube which I hope is but the first of many more to come.

11683973.review:
Wonderful game! I have only played it through the once, but I will definitely be playing it more and more so that I can get all the different endings and so on :)

To be more formal in the review format, I'd say this game reminds me a lot of Long Live the Queen by Hanako. It is a visual novel, and choice is the most critical thing. I haven't even glossed the surface of what the various choices can lead to, but the game is definitely good at making your choice be valued.

The visuals are adorable, if a bit simple. They work well for the story they're trying to tell. The story is based on the Cinderella fairy tale (it took me way too long to make that connection) but it takes that structure and story idea and really makes a fascinating pathway through. I got attached to the characters and their situations in a far more detailed way than I would in a typical story following Cinderella conventions. 

I believe I got this game on a Humble Bundle deal, however given the depth and whatnot, I'd say it is well worth the price. My first playthrough took me about two and a half hours and I've still got many an ending to unlock and various achievements to get. 

If you like female protagonists and stories that involve strong female leads you will like this. If you're a fan of the visual novel genre, you will like this. And if you like literary subversion, I'd say you'd like this. Grab it!

11652354.review:

11630816.review: Good atmosphere, lovely music, bunch of variations, got me:) There is a few point, where i'd like it to appreciate more the decisions, but it's beautiful game for those, who like this genre.

11615607.review:
Playing this game reminds me of the interesting module GAT330: Interactive Narrative and Character Creation that I took in USA. Basically this is a story of Cinderella, whereby player take control of the mentioned character and make choices in the thinking and dialouge process whereby it ultimately makes the ending that can be very different from the old school fairy tale. 

As for the choice I made, I choose to elope with the Prince Charming's Captain Guard instead because after all, I wanted a different twist to the original story and if I am closer to the Captain Guard, why not?

Excellent story visual novel telling! I wouldn't mind playing again months later to see how my other choices can adversely affect the outcome of the original story. Excellent artwork with subtle but powerful transition as well. 

I definately want to create a twist to an original fairy tale/game in the near future as I am quite inspired by the execution of the entire game in terms of the direction that it is going.

Highly Recommended to everyone!

11481071.review:
Remember when your grandma used to read you Cinderella and you were thinking: "what's wrong with her, why she never stands up to those nasty sisters and horrid stepmother, at least, she could drop some flies in their soup, get some ants to their beds and some giant spiders to they rooms".
Well, Cinders doesn't do all those childish things, but your childish dream can be more than fulfilled in this game. Cinders can do things and go places and be mean if need be, and there is need, as we all know.
Another great thing about Cinders, we see motivations behind actions, nobody is evil just for the sake of making somebody else look pitiful.
This VN is satisfactory on many levels. It looks nice too, dialogue is good and great at times.
There are many endings and some heavy choices. Choices are most of the time too obvious, though, but it's hard to expect otherwise when we are talking about so well known tale.

I recommend it for all VN fans out there.

11468833.review: Sehr schön gezeichnetes interaktives Aschenputtel Märchen komplett in leicht verständlichem Englisch. Deswegen gibt es auch viele verschiedene Ausgänge der Geschichte. Spielt man das Spiel dann erneut kann mal alle bereits bekannten Dialoge direkt überspringen. 11466911.review:
Best Visual Novel I've played to completion on Steam, bar none. 

Its art and presentation are gorgeous, with subtle movements doing much to break up the static nature of a VN. The writing is smart, witty and clever and the characters themselves compliment the themes of the story with aplomb. The game is somewhat insistent with its themes, but they're pretty good things to hear and I think anyone can gain something or learn something about themselves from reading this. 

It hits all the high notes. The characters are nuanced and complicated and the decisions you make really do make an impact; the game even has a nice feature that notifies you when changes to the plot and dialogue is happening. It's just an exceptionally well-built VN that does an admirable job at deconstructing and toying with fairy tale tropes. I recommend it immensely.

11456859.review: All around one of the best independent narrative-based games around. The art and music are on par with larger-production houses, and the game mechanics keep the story running smoothly. The team would have benefited greatly from a writer to punch up some of the dialogue, but all-in-all an interesting take on the classic Cinderella story.

11419644.review:
I picked up this game after never having had much of an interest in interactive novels, and can say that this game is very easy to pick up for those new to the genre. Having not played or researched many games of the genre, I can't really comment on how innovative this is within the context of its genre. I was thinking of postponing a review of Cinders until after I had played more of the genre, but I doubt I will do this in the near future. So here is a review, to be returned to if I do ever have something to add.

A pretty great interactive take on a classic tale, the large amount of well thought-out endings based on choices made through the game lend well to the feeling of coming of age of the heroine, Cinders. It is also a refreshing take to give Cinderella more agency and control over her life, though she as a character may not realise how much influence she has. The endings closest to the original fairytale really felt well-earned as you really felt like you had to push Cinders to making responsible decisions despite the temptation to let Cinders be snarky and dwell on revenge.

All-in-all the decisions felt quite organic in how they impacted the story despite the fixed events throughout the story and the number of game-influencing variables which is remarkable in any game. I thoroughly enjoyed replaying to find all the endings and the variants therein, and the eight save slots, fast-forward function and the flower indicator for branching story moments were a great help in this. It would have been nice to have an even faster way of scrolling or even skipping to the next decision, but what was there worked well.

The music was great and perfectly suited to the mood of the game, and so were the beautiful painted-looking environments.  The touch of movement and change in lighting was also well done, present but subtle. The character design is very solidly well done, such that the few trappings of anime and manga in the style are not off-putting even to those who they do not appeal to.

It is great to see this smart and well-made interactive retelling of Cinderella come to Steam where sales will hopefully help it reach a much greater audience.

11389944.review:
A more mature and realistic take on the classic fairy tale of Cinderella.  Ever wonder why the stepmother is mean, despite  being  a single aging noble trying to keep her house together?  Ever wonder why the Stepsisters are cold and bitter? maybe they don't have it so great either! 

 No, this is not disney where everything is black and white.  This is a great take on Cinderella, where if you really want to you can try to live the classic fairy tale and marry the prince at the end, but why do that when you could fix the relationship with your stepsisters? or screw the prince, go for the ruggedly handsome captain of the guard instead! your call.  

Very enjoyable experience, with characters who act realistically and a great style of art.  (I especially love the Scoundrel's hat!!)

11385979.review:
+Lots of choices
+Well-written dialogue
+Beautiful artwork

-Controls seem a little off
-Girly theme might not appeal to all

Overall score: 8/10

To begin, let me start off by saying that Cinderella is my least favorite fairy tale princess. Why? Because Cinderella cries and her Fairy Godmother magically fixes everything for her. Seriously? A crybaby princess? I think I’d prefer narcoleptic Sleeping Beauty over that.

Thankfully, Cinders is not that story.

Instead, Cinders is a game where you need to decipher the motivations and secrets of the people around you. You want a Fairy Godmother? Of course you can have one! You just have to work for it. You have to use logic to figure out what the best choices are, and, unlike some other VNs, the choices you have to make actually do make sense when you think about it. There are also many choices to make (I counted 47 on my first playthrough), so the game has plenty of re-playability if you want to get every ending. In addition, I found the artwork to be beautiful (or at least charming) and the dialogue was very believable (and funny at times).

The two critiques I have of this game were easily overlooked by me, but I figured they were worth mentioning. First, the buttons are a little off. Intuitively, you would think that you would hover over the words for each button in order to make your choice. However, you actually have to be about half a centimeter above the buttons in order to click things. It’s not a deal-breaker, but it’s slightly annoying. Second, you’re playing as Cinders. Therefore, the game has an obviously girly theme. Even as a girl, I always thought that fairy tale princesses were too girly, and I never cared for them that much. I can imagine that, as a guy, this game might be a bit much. However, I would like to say that you can definitely still enjoy Cinders if you’re a masculine guy, as long as you’re an avid fan of VNs. If you think it’s still too girly, wait until Moa Cube releases Solstice.

Overall, Cinders is a very good VN and if you’re fan of the genre, you should definitely give this one a go.

11384365.review:
Score: 7/10

'm not sure I'd pay the full $20 price for any visual novel, but if your going to throw out that kind of money it should be at a visual novel like this one. Cinders is so far the best experience of that genre (edit: now "Eden" is). The multiple endings aren't as creative is I was hoping for originally, but they were fun all the same. The choices given mid game are actually more interesting then the end much like in Soul Gambler. The story is done very well and the characters are well developed. The only thing I would have wished for was more shocking outcomes... after all with these women I expected to feel the drama at the end more.

11377956.review: This game is fun with beautiful art work. & worth playing multiple times. Cinderella is one of my favorite childhood tales. Being able to choose many different paths and how I want the story to end is very enjoyable.

11355722.review: I initally purchased this game as part of a Humble Bundle, and of the six games I got that day this was by far the most absorbing!
