11349324.review:
Cinders is very much an interactive novel more than it is a game. By biggest gripe is that whilst you do make choices that can alter the storyline and the ending, there isn't much variation aside from a few scenes playing out differently and a different set of text showing up for the ending 'cutscene'.

But other than that it is a well crafted title. The art work is good and unlike similar games the characters have some (albeit limited) animation. Since you will probably play through the game multiple times there is a very useful function that allows you to quickly skip through dialogue you have already seen, stopping at anything that is new and at any choice you have to make.

If you are a fan of reading and fairy tales you will probably enjoy the game. If a wall of text sends you in to a fit of rage then you should probably avoid this one. Overall I'd give it a thumbs up.

11340180.review: Beautiful game that lets you make decisions with so many different outcomes. Your choices are all meaningful in some way and it really speaks to philosophical questions about fate. One play through will make you curious about what would have happened differently if you would have met with this person or said something else or chosen a different path. Queen? Dead? Escaped? It's definitely interesting and the art and music are enjoyable, as well as the non-traditional story... this takes choose your own adventure books to a new level, how about define your own fairy tale! Great introduction to the visual novel genre!

11338219.review: Visually stunning, inticing story, 10 out of 10 would recommend

11336462.review:
Cinders: 8/10.

Cinders is a Visual Novel game, telling the tale of Cinderella. I'll be honest, I don't know much about the original story, so I can't say how close it follows that story (all I can say for sure is that there are "evil" stepsisters and stepmother, and the whole "glass slipper" part, everything else I'm not familiar with), but the story presented in Cinders was very well done. During my three and a half hour playthrough, I had to choose between one of four endings, and many other side plots (such as romantic interests, how you interact with with your stepsisters, etc.). While most of your choices don't mean much in the grand scheme of things, I did appreciate the fact that you are presented with a fair amount of choices, and multiple interesting choices for each (for example, do I want to lower the price with the shopkeeper by haggling, being seductive, appealing to friendship, or just pay full price? And then, if you do get to lower the price, do you spend that money (which is your stepmother's) on yourself, or give it to her?).

One thing that I really enjoyed, that I haven't seen in my limited experience in VNs, is that the game tells you (visually, with a flower that is displayed in the top right of the screen) when you view a conversation that can have different outcomes. This, combined with the fact that you can super fast-forward through text you've already seen, means that it gave me a big enough incentive to replay the game multiple times. With four different endings, and multiple other minor differentiations, I ended up spending about eight hours total.

While not important, the graphics are very impressive. Not only this, but characters are animated as are minor background pieces. This game definitely delivers in the "Eye Candy" department in the Humble Bundle I got it in.

I can't think of anything negative about the game...it is a VN, so this game won't be for everyone, but for what it is, it does it well. I would recommend this game, if you're into stories and/or VNs.

11335967.review: It is a very mature approach to the Cinderella story. Interesting dialogue, very witty. There is also gorgeous art and the music is wonderful, it's interesting how one different decision can change a lot of things in the story, and while there are 4 endings, there are many variations to each one.

11309813.review: I really enjoyed this game. The artwork is absolutely breath-taking, and it is worth playing the game just to look at the beautiful scenery. 11297895.review:

This game had some weak writing at points, but the characters felt real. Like they were written by someone with world experience. Villians don't have to be viillans because they wear a black cape and hate people. Maybe they're not really villians at all.

11293316.review: Good story with high quality "live" illustrations and cool music. It's so interesting to choose various decisions and wonder how it change whole story. I recommend this game and I will play it some times.

11283988.review:
Game: Cinders
Style: Visual Novel
Length: 4 hours for 2 play throughs
Overall impression: Meh.

*** Spoiler Free Review ***

Cinders is a visual novel which means plenty of reading.  There is no voice acting so if that isn't your thing you should pass.  As the game's title suggests this is a different take on the classic fairy tale Cinderella with several differnt ways to end the story.  The biggest question in this style of game is usually "How much does my decisions throughout the game change the story?"  the answer to this question is the usual amount.  The decisions you make for the vast majority of the game seems to replace one piece of interchangable diologue with another.  It seems that if Cinders acts in a largely uncarictaristic manner the supporting will seem to forget previous conversations and act accordingly which kind of killed the mood for me.  Ultimately only a few decisions actually change the ending but an unexpected surprise is that the decisions you make add some nice flavor to the endings which is a really nice touch.  Often times in Cinders characters make social commentary this may rub some people the wrong way considering the political nature of video games at the moment, so, be prepared for that. 

Astetics and music: The game is illustrated by Gracjana Zielinska and the influence is there in spades and this gives the game an amazing look.  The music is nice and enjoyable but knows its place in a background role so if you are a slower reader the music doesn't get annoying which I think is important for this style of game. 

Is it worth the money?  The game is currently $19.99 on steam although it was recently a part of the humble eye candy bundle.  I can't reccomend this title at the current price tag.  If the games goes on sale for under $5 or if the bundle returns it will be well worth a play through.

11283007.review: Fantastic writing.  It's like a choose your own adventure novel - kept me gripped from start to finish.  Imagine the Cinderella story from an adult's perspective, with familial ties and duty, and you have this good game.  Less than 3 hours.

11278431.review:
I consider Cinders to be a much mature and enhanced version of one of our most beloved childhood fairy tales, Cinderella. The story is not predictable at all, in fact Cinders has multiple endings and a large number of possibilities. Your decisions affect the gameplay and throughout several playthroughs  you discover different facets of the same idea: your life is a story which only you are able to write.

11274067.review: I bought this game on Humble Bundle since it came with a bunch of visually pleasing looking games. Out of sheer curiosity I tried this one because I loved the artwork and figured I could use a change of pace and just play this Visual Novel on nights I just want to relax. Which is strange because it is incredibly repetitive since it is just a story, but I love just unlocking all the endings and seeing all the variations within the game. My sis and I have played this for hours now and we haven't tired of it yet. Incredibly unexpected from a Visual Novel, but definitely a pleasant surprise.  If you're looking for something casual and fun to play as you relax, I definitely recommend this game. My only big issue with this is that the dialogue can feel really preachy and didactic, to the point it gets a little pretentious. Certain characters aren't as fleshed out as others (i.e. The Prince, The Fairy, etc.), and then I feel the dev really pushes you to like and respect certain characters when in reality they're still quite awful no matter what choices you make in the game. But all in all, there are plenty of dialogue gems within this game that out weight the cons, and I've been hooked since day one.

11266119.review:

Writing? Or artwork?

11253121.review:
Ho acquistato Cinders come parte di un Humble Bundle, attratto dal suo stile grafico e dalla premessa narrativa: una classicissima fiaba, "Cenerentola" nientemeno, ri-raccontata come un vecchio Librogame, un "Choose your own adventure" per gli anglofili. Un racconto ramificato nel quale scegliere, di volta in volta, una versione diversa della "nostra" Cinders. Ma non è questo l'aspetto veramente interessante della visual novel in questione, quanto il fatto che sia scritta in maniera ottima. Ogni personaggio - Cinders, le sue sorellastre Sophia e Gloria, sua madre, Lady Carmosa, e gli altri comprimari - emerge in maniera "viva" dal testo di questa specie di "improvvisazione sul tema". Ognuno di essi mostra una piccola parte del suo carattere sulla base delle scelte del lettore-giocatore, lasciando sottintendere una profondità notevole di motivazioni, sentimenti, opinioni che (e qui viene il bello) tende a cambiare a seconda delle scelte (a onor del vero non tantissime) che si fanno durante il racconto. 
Cinders non è semplicemente un gioco: è una riflessione sulla Fiaba, un affresco delle diverse sfaccettature delle personalità femminili, un "non è tutto semplice come sembra" (provate a chiedervi: ma perché la matrigna e le sorellastre sono per forza "cattive"? E se Cenerentola si fosse messa nei loro panni?). 
Inoltre, e giova sempre ricordarlo, non ci sono molte fiabe che vadano oltre lo stereotipo della poverella che diventa principessa. Cinders è molto di più: è una ragazza che ha la possibilità di rifiutare il dono delle fate, di proclamare la sua indipendenza, di rifiutare persino la proposta di matrimonio del Principe. Dipende tutto dal giocatore: dunque, voi chi volete essere veramente? 
In definitiva: non è un'esperienza per tutti, ma solo per chi ama la gioia di una storia ben raccontata e vuole divertirsi a "ritoccarla" godendosi, allo stesso tempo, delle illustrazioni notevoli, un commento musicale assolutamente adeguato e la possibilità di rigiocarlo tante volte quanti sono i finali alternativi della storia (potendo, va detto, saltare tutto il testo già letto in precedenza). Avvertenza: non è un gioco (si "gioca" poco, a meno che per giocare non intendiamo "usare l'immaginazione" e non i pollici) ed è FONDAMENTALE conoscere bene l'inglese.

This game is Cinderella retold as a choose-your-own-story. I was a bit skeptical at first, thinking this would be the typical "Oh, a fifteen minute story. Great." but the first runthrough took me about an hour and I loved it every step of the way. There's a bunch of different endings and choices, and it really doesn't feel like you're being driven to choose a certain path. Each replay will give you around 20 minutes of gametime, and each ending is genuinely different. It's a fun little game that you'll enjoy.

11133779.review:
Nie ukrywam, że grę dostałam z Humble Bundle, więc nie zapłaciłam za nią (była dla mnie gratisem, nie dla niej kupowałam pakiet). Stwierdziłam jednak, że skoro nie miałam wcześniej okazji grać w podobne tytuły, to spróbuję. To mogła być dobra odskocznia... W końcu nie ma tu biegania, strzelania, misji, które trzeba powtarzać kilkanaście razy, aby osiągnąć wysoki score. 

Przede wszystkim, gra jest naprawdę przyjemna graficznie. Takie było moje pierwsze wrażenie. Niestety, jest też monotonna i przy 1-1,5 godzinnej rozgrywce, trochę nudzi. 
I tu przejdę do fabuły. Gra z założenia ma 4 zakończenia. Zależnie od naszych decyzji, podejmowanych w trakcie opowiadania historii. I tu pojawia się problem... Z trudem dotarłam do jednego zakończenia i nie miałam nawet drobnych wątpliwości - nie będę szukać pozostałych. 
Głównym problemem są dialogi. Prowadzone przez 10-15 plansz, gdzie połowa tego, byłaby wystarczająca. Prawie po każdym dialogu, główna postać robi równie długie podsumowanie, tego co przed chwilą miało miejsce. 
Dla kogoś kto nie zna tego rodzaju gier, zdecydowanie strata czasu. 
Myślę, że mogę polecić tym, którzy ten typ klikanek znają i szukają czegoś nowego. 

Ja niestety, nie dopisuję tego do moich ulubionych tytułów.

11098689.review:
어른들을 위한 신데렐라.
상당히 미려한 배경과 예쁜 캐릭터들, 감미로운 음악이 함께하는 어른들의 동화. 잔혹동화인가 싶기도 했는데, 그렇게까지 잔인하고 괴악한 장면이 나오지는 않는다. 막장 요소는 충만하지만.

단순히 "신데렐라는 어려서 부모님을 잃고요, 계모와 언니들에게 구박을 받았드래요~"같은 어렸을 적 동화 내용이 아닌, 계모와 언니들을 포함한 각 등장인물들에게 어느 정도 당위성을 주는 등, 입체적인 캐릭터 묘사가 인상적이다. 또한 추가적인 캐릭터들도 별 위화감 없이 잘 동화되는 모습. 또, 동화의 특성상 시대나 지역에 따라 내용의 디테일이 조금씩 바뀌기도 하는데, 그런 것들을 전부 반영하여 여지를 남겨두는듯한 모습을 보여주기도 한다. 원작 반영도 뛰어난 편.

다양한 멀티 엔딩도 특징적. 어느 정도 뻔하고 제한적인 상황에서 맞이할 수 있는 그럴듯한 결말들을 다 구경할 수 있다. 우리가 흔히 알고 있는 왕자와 결혼해서 행복하게 살았대요~ 같은 엔딩부터, 오로라공주 뺨 후려갈길만한 대막장 엔딩도 가능. 선택지에 따라 신데렐라의 다양한 인성을 몸소 구경할 수 있다.

다만 이런 게임에 의레 느껴질 아쉬움 두 가지. 스킵이 아주 편하지 않다는 것과 한글로 즐길 수 없다는 것은 두고두고 남을 아쉬움이 될 것이다. 그렇다곤 해도 이런 게임이 여러 사정으로 조금 묻히게 된 것 같아 조금 서운하긴 하겠지만.

Przyznam, że nie miałem wcześniej okazji zagrania w grę typu visual novel. Cinders to moje pierwsze zetknięcie z gatunkiem, a zachęcony zostałem głównie przez piękne grafiki i dość niską cenę na Humble Bundle. I jakie wrażenia?

Niezwykle pozytywne. Gra wygląda pięknie, i pod tym względem się nie zawiodłem, ponieważ jak wspomniałem wyżej, to właśnie grafika mnie bardzo zachęciła do zagrania. Ale też brzmi fantastycznie! Muzyka jest przepiękna, przypomina mi soundtrack z legendarnego Heroes of Might and Magic III! Idealnie zapętlona, nie nudzi się i pięknie wprowadza w baśniowy klimat.

Co do samej fabuły, przyznam, że kiedy zorientowałem się, że to po prostu przerobiony Kopciuszek, to delikatnie się zawiodłem, ponieważ oczekiwałem czegoś w pełni oryginalnego. Szybko jednak powróciło zadowolenie, ponieważ historia jest ukazana w sposób dużo głębszy i bardziej dojrzały niż w zwykłej baśni - postaci są dużo bardziej skomplikowane, nie ma się pewności, czy dany bohater jest dobry, czy zły, wszystkie wybory są trudne, poznajemy dużo różnych perspektyw i poglądów na otaczający nas świat.

Grę skończyłem tylko raz, ale widzę, że ilość zakończeń i ścieżek którymi można podążyć jest naprawdę duża. Moje zakończenie, z pozoru miało być jak najbardziej pozytywne, jednak kiedy na koniec przeczytałem co się działo dalej, to nabrałem ochoty na powtórną rozgrywkę. Na pewno pomaga w tym opcja przewijania scen które już się widziało, dzięki czemu można grę eksplorować bez konieczności spędzania zbyt długiego czasu nad tymi samymi dialogami.

Podsumowując: grę polecam.

11076739.review: A new and more realistic take on a timeless tale, Cinders is an experiance I thoughly enjoyed and one I whole-heartedly recomend.

11075242.review:
A visual novel based on the story Cinderella. 
This game really presents itself well; it's probably the most polished visual novel I've played, with the only real issue being a typo I found. Simple things like the effect of text appearing on the screen look really great.
The art style is colorful, beautiful, and detailed. There's some animation effects on the backgrounds which adds a lot more to the feel of the game than you'd expect. Just small things like water of a lake shimmering, fire moving, sunrays, and things like that. The only character animations are really facial expressions, and sometimes they'll shift poses, but that's more of a rare thing... though the characters will change outfits or poses for different scenes.
The music is really well done and there's a good variety here, but nothing I really focused on much.

There are 4 endings, but multiple variations of those endings based on how you treated certain characters and things like that. So there's some replayability here, but the story still plays out mostly the same, with just some extra scenes and dialogue peppered in based on some choices you make. A lot of times I felt like the banter back and forth may not add a whole lot to the story, and doesn't create that much extra character depth... ultimately leading to longish periods of time between choice branches. This could also limit replayability, but there is a button to fast-forward through the dialogue that will still pause when there's a choice to be made, or when you reach a new scene you haven't seen before. A really awesome feature. Even though you can skip through quickly using this method, it still takes a LONG time to fast-forward through everything. The story is kind of that long... I think when I started a new story to get a different ending, it still took me an hour to play through even though I fast-forwarded through the majority of the story.

The choices in this game can affect a lot, I think. Even though the majority of scenes STILL happen no matter what, the differences in the story with how the characters treat you (and even how your character treats them) provides a more personal feel... rather than picking options that feel out-of-place of your character, your character changes with your options. It's pretty nice in this way.

Another really awesome detail this game provides is when you unlock achievements (which relate to the story and in-game decisions.) With each one you unlock, a change happens to the main menu screen... most of the time an item gets added to the scene. It's really a nice detail and just goes to show how much attention was put into this game. There's also a "reward" menu where you can see all the unique things you've unlocked, which is nice.

Overall, the game is plenty long... I think my first play-through took around 3 hours... which is fairly typical. The long-windedness of some of the dialogue is the only thing that started to fatigue me. There are a lot of choices to be made to keep the interaction up and keep you engaged... the pacing is pretty good overall. When I first started playing the story seemed to throw in your face the fact that the story is Cinderella, which I found a bit annoying and obnoxious, but after that was over with I really enjoyed it. It's Cinderella, so don't expect anything crazy with the main story... you're able to personalize it a bit with your own choices, but all the major plot-points are always hit.

I'm definitely keeping an eye out on what this developer puts out next. I hope it's a new, unique story with the same love and care put into it that this game had.

11073983.review:
I have really, really enjoyed Cinders. It feels very real, and I really appreciate the work that has gone into developing the theme of self-determination (or maybe that's just the theme of my first playthrough). I'm amazed that it's supporting my efforts to build relationships with Cinder's sisters and it seems to be "paying" off.

This is one of the games that really, really hits the spot. It's not "Gone Home" yet, but at the same time, I haven't finished it.

Must buy, especially during the humble bundle. I would have paid full price for it.

And the designer has a really amazing blog. http://moacube.com/blog/

I sound like a shill, but it's really good thoughtful stuff.

11073736.review:
Just beat this game, and I found the story to be very well-done and robust. 

The artwork, atmosphere, and music are all great and flow very well with the theme of the game. There isn't much motion, as it is more of an interactive story, but the subtle movements by the background are nice.

If you like choose-your-own-adventure style books (I read those Goosebumps ones in my childhood) and reading in general, then you should like playing this game. The choices are very interesting if you can really immerse yourself within the story. The themes centralize around things like freedom/duty/oppression/etc, and I think dystopian-lovers might find some elements here to suit their tastes (although the game does not take place in a dystopia).

I got this game in a bundle, and I think the price may be a bit too high (if you don't like reading that much), so maybe wait for it to go on sale if the price is too much for you.

11071719.review:
Начать стоит с того, что это визуальная новелла, поэтому если вам такой жанр не по вкусу, пробуйте с осторожностью. Если же вы не знаете, стоит ли пробовать, немного плюсов игры:

 - Стиль. Визуально игра красива, обладает хорошей атмосферой и цельным дизайном. Всё в тон игре, всё подходит друг другу, никаких выбивающихся моментов или деталей. Словно листаешь страницы огромной книги сказок с иллюстрациями.

 - Сюжет. Старая сказка на взрослый лад. Из простой истории про девушку, которая нашла своего принца, разработчики сделали притчу о свободе, последствиях собственных решений и стремлении к независимости, которая как вредит, так и помогает. Здесь нет "плохих" или "хороших", есть сложные люди со сложными судьбами, и средневековье, где всё было куда суровее чем в сказках.

 - Реиграбельность. Да, вы не ослышались. Эту игру можно проходить десяток раз, благодаря двум важным вещам. Первая, концовок четыре, но у каждой есть варианты. Попытаетесь жениться на принце - вот вам несколько вариантов того, какой королевой будете, упомянут, что вы сделали с семьей, и была ли любовь безответна. Невольно пробирает любопытство, как могло всё повернуться? А для переигрывания есть отличная вещь - пропуск уже прочитанных диалогов.  Хорош он тем, что останавливается, как только меняется диалог - показывая, что именно вы своими действиями поменяли.

И, может, играть в нее вы будете не очень часто, зато каждый раз что-то да пойдёт по другому.

11064705.review:
This game is fantastic!  The art is beautiful (like many have said), I wanted to learn more about the characters, and I want to play it again!  My friend and I played this simultaneously and arrived at very different conclusions, and even getting the same "ending" can have variations within. 

There are also many small details, like the slight movements in the background and characters' eyes, and how the text sounds different depending on the character that is speaking.  I can see many more hours going into this game, no regrets!

11063850.review:
The premise follows that Cinders acts as a retelling of the classic Cinderella legend, except that, in an attempt to actively subvert what is known as the "Disneyfied" 1950's animated film that can in many ways can be considered nothing more than glitz with a bit of a moral, this game allows not only for very distinct and non-black-and-white player choice options but fleshes out each character in new and unexpected directions.

And I *love* it.

Gone are the cookie-cutter Step-Mother drones Anastasia and Drizella and enter their respective counterparts Sophia and Gloria, and while Gloria does questionably attempt to enact her mother's will on the other two sisters, Sophia constantly snarks, talks back, and even actively rebels against both Gloria and Lady Carmosa, this game's (not-so) Evil Step Mother. This visual novel is all about giving us reasons to understand why these characters act the way they do, and obviously I don't want to spoil anything, but contrary to the popular notion that the antagonists (or anti-heroes in this story) are in cahoots, *nobody* likes each other. And despite her cruelty, even said step-mother has her issues, where most of her actions are explained, understandable, and sympathetic. (In my playthrough, I never got a good answer for why she treats Cinders like an old rag, though.)

Of course, what to do with this information is for you to decide. If you feel like disregarding any understanding of these characters' own personal plights and personally attacking them whenever they get in your way, you are allowed this option. Maybe you want to pick a side in this sisterly conflict and get close to Sophia or Gloria; this is something you may do as well. In fact, participating in the subversion of this fairy tale is entirely up to you. You may wish to ask the fairies for help, marry the prince at the expense of your sisters' and step-mother's chances, and live Happily Ever After The End, assuming you can even reach that point. You can also be like me and revell in the story's subversive qualities, actively trying to understand and unite the sisters against their overbearing mother. It's all up to you, and no matter which path you take, the game's story never ever falters, because it's the story *you* want to make. It helps that the game's writing and story are (mostly) beautiful in each path and never fails to at least be interesting.

Also, if you couldn't tell by the video and screenshots, the visuals and audio are top-notch. While the somewhat sparse and somewhat static character models can be a bit stiff in their animations (Cinders herself seems to be placed in a perpetual slouch, which, when you think about it, is kind of the point), the backgrounds are always stunningly gorgeous, with details that come alive despite through their hand-drawn aesthetic. The BGM makes up for its limited selection by being amazingly well-produced, even while synthetic (nobody would have expected a full orchestra from an indie studio anyway). The design here is elegent in its subtlety, with slightly differing text sounds for different characters' speech and dim auras surrounding the current speaker.

I only take small issue in some of the design choices. For instance, I wish that the game wouldn't notify me whenever a consequence of a certain past decision is being played out. Every time I make a choice, its resulting difference is noted by a small plant symbol that appears in the upper-right corner of the screen. Often these are made up of small speech alterations that have little effect on the main story except for alterations in the character's dispositions and their own personal decisions, and sometimes I couldn't tell how a certain sentence would have differed had I made a different choice, or what choice with which that particular piece of text was even associated. Regardless, I'd much rather the mystery of how my decisions change the story be left to my own intuition.

Also on the subject of choices, I wish the game wouldn't limit the ability to rewind through decisions made to see all of their immediate effects, especially if the feature's primary marketability involves important and lasting changes that won't necessarily take affect until much later in the story (and at that point, who wants to rewind that far back?). If the game wants me to shape the story the way I see fit, then there's really no need to limit this feature. I understand that certain decisions are meant to be important, lasting, and heavy, and perhaps a rewind feature would take away from this heaviness (there was a moment late in the game where I was confronted with a decision that would essentially determine the ending I'd get and I had to think very hard about my decision), but there are just as many conversational choices that have exactly the opposite effect of their perceived intention. I found myself in a conversation with Gloria on Day 4 during which I said some things I wish I hadn't, and, given the option to take them back, I probably would have. Perhaps this is meant to reflect the weight of real-life decision-making, but this game isn't about that. It's about player choice, and if I'm given a choice that, when chosen, results in the opposite of its intended effect (e.g. Cinders says something rude and condescending when I meant the comment to be compassionate and understanding), then I'd like the option to take it back.

Finally, and least importantly, some of the writing in the game is a bit off. Cinders often goes about psychoanalyzing literally everybody she meets, and while this isn't chiefly wrong, since it supports the game's concept of fairy-tale subversion by revealing very real character traits in the people she encounters, it is a bit heavy-handed and perhaps a bit too obvious. Sometimes I wish I could figure these things out for myself without necessarily having Cinders tell me (and the character) directly, and there are other ways for Cinders to handle the conversations and actions she engages. There are a couple of blatant (but necessary) exposition dumps, but this isn't too horrible. There is also some questionable grammar, like the use of -t instead of -ed (e.g. "spoilt" instead of "spoiled") but this may be era-specific, or the use of a "than" in place of a "then" or a "where" in place of a "were."

These are minor complaints compared to the quality of the game. If you want to play through it four times to unlock all four endings, it's definitely worth $20. Each playthrough will last you about 5 hours, depending on your reading speed. If you only want to play through it once, it's in the current Humble Bundle (as of writing this), or you can wait for the next big sale.

11063081.review:
Cinders is a lovely and charming game. I'm a sucker for fairy tale retellings, and this one really does do it for me. The variety of endings you can get based on your choices makes this extremely replayable, and none of the endings or paths are directly linear. Of course this does mean you'll have to revisit a lot of conversations again, but luckily there is a Skip function that will glaze over scenes you've already seen. 

Needless to say, the art is beautiful. So much love and care went into the details of the environment, as well as making sure the characters properly emote. Writing is pretty good, with my only complaint being that the dialogue for Cinders felt a little out of place from the setting. (Possibly an attempt to be more relatable to the player?) It's a small nitpick in a sea of praise though. I loved this game, and would be all over another fairytale retelling from the developers.

11062371.review:
Out of all the VNs I've played on Steam, this one takes the cake. It has a lot more content, variation, and depth compared to most other titles and it's an interesting take on Cinderella. The choices are not limited to A or B and the multiple variations per ending add a nice twist for those who enjoy somewhat specific/customized paths. The art is also very beautiful. That's a huge deal for some people so I'm glad that it was the first thing about this game to captivate me.

5/5. It's a solid VN.

11061503.review:
I just finished this story for the first time. It was beautiful and extremely well written. I enjoyed it immensely and found the story very moving. I was often crying because of its wonderful twists and turns. Already I am wondering how things might be different, what if I romance a character, choose a different goal, or a different method. 

There are so many obvious ways to change the plot, and yet the beatiful branches that appear suggest that there are many subtle ways to influence it also. 

I'm a person who will reread a book over and over if I find it good enough. This is no different, I would love to read this again even if it would be exactly the same, knowing that I can make it different each time only heightens my desire to read this again.

As you can probably see, I'm reviwing this mostly as a story. This is because that is what it is. I am glad they didn't try to put a thin veneer of game onto this story because I think they focussed on what was important, and that is a part of what makes this so good.

11061296.review: For a Visual Novel I expected something better than just a retelling of Cinderella, it was also a bit short for a visual novel. Though getting it from a bundle wasn't that bad of a deal and it's probably unfair for me to compare Cinders to Japanese visual novels.

11056857.review: I absolutely love this game! The artwork is beautiful (for the female characters anyway. They could have spent a little more time on their male counterparts) and the dialogue is surprisingly intriguing for a game of this type. It has some deep moments. I recomend this game to everyone. If you liked Kinetic novels like Junipers Knot you will really enjoy this.

11020597.review:
Cinders est une Visual Novel, un jeu dans lequel on suit une histoire comme dans un livre mais dans laquelle on peut influer et influencer le devenir de notre pauvre héroïne. Le jeu reprend donc l'historie traditionnelle de Cendrillon mais en y rajoutant énormément énormément d'éléments nouveaux et d'intéractions entre les différents personnages.

Loin du conte de fée, Cinders fait la part belle à son histoire remarquablement bien écrite et mise en scène graphiquement et musicalement. Le jeu est en anglais intégral et autant vous dire qu'il faudra un certain niveau d'anglais pour tout suivre et comprendre les choix qui nous sont proposés. Le jeu est donc linéaire dans sa structure, on suit l'histoire et à certains moments importants, le jeu nous demande de faire un choix, ca peut être un soutien à une de ses sœurs, un endroit à visiter plutôt qu'un autre ou alors des choix moraux qui vont influer sur la personnalité de notre personnage mais aussi des autres protagonistes.

Le jeu ne reprend pas la structure vue dans Long Live The Queen, il n'y a pas de points à affecter dans certaines compétences, ce sont de simples choix mais qui importent au final car de ces choix vont dépendre la trame principale de l'histoire et la fin qui nous sera proposée. Si vous souhaitez découvrir toutes les fins possibles et débloquer tous les achievements, il faudra compter 7-8 heures. Heureusement le jeu est bien fait et on peut accélérer les dialogues que l'on a déjà lues pour arriver à l'essentiel. Autre bon point, on peut revenir en arrière si on a raté un dialogue important avec le scroll de la souris. On ne peut pas revenir sur un choix important en revanche, le jeu nous permet de sauvegarder ce qui vous évitera de regretter un choix tendancieux.

L'histoire est le vrai point fort du jeu, elle est rudement bien menée, les choix sont intéressants et le jeu n'est pas uniquement réservé à un public féminin grâce à l'intelligence des personnages et à leurs personnalités. Il n'y a pas de méchant ou de gentil, chacun fait ses propres choix en leur âme et conscience, les sœurs ne sont pas fondamentalement mauvaises, elles ont leurs raisons, idem pour le prince et la mère castratrice. On ne peut pas vraiment détester les personnages ce qui rend d'autant plus difficiles certains choix car il faudra faire des sacrifices pour avancer.

Le jeu n'est pas tout jeune, il est disponible depuis 2012 mais il n'est disponible sur Steam que depuis quelques semaines à un prix avantageux. Sachez également que la bande son est disponible au prix que vous le souhaitez ce qui est intéressant tant elle ajoute une autre dimension au jeu. Je vous conseille donc fortement ce jeu si vous aimez les histoires adultes et non manichéennes dotées d'une très belle réalisation. Sachez également que les cartes Steam peuvent valoir jusqu'à 1 € ce qui peut permettre de rentabiliser le jeu encore plus rapidement.

11013045.review: I love this game... I bought it in the Summer Sale and haven't stopped playing it since. I'm trying to play it until I have unlocked all the endings ... and there are alot of endings you can achieve (check out Cinders Wiki for a full list of the endings but warning spoilers) I have even gone as far as to create an excel spreadsheet that has every choice that I have made in each of my games so I can work out what I have already done in simular games to make sure I can unlock a different ending each time I play it... I know, anal right? But I'm loving this game at the moment. As you can see from the images previewed for this game, the art work is really beautiful, unlike some Visual novel games you see on the market that are drawn badly. The writing is really good also...havent found any spelling errors yet. The music in this game is really good too... so good that I had to purchase the download for the OST of Cinders and I love it... really good. It all works really well together and a lot of fun re-playing the game to try and get the different endings and achievements. This is the best visual novel game that I have played and I would love it if Moacube could create another fairytale Visual novel game like this one although they have just annouced a new game called 'Solstice' on Greenlight so if you like Cinders you should vote on Greenlight for Solstice.

11004256.review:
The unfortunate flaw of this game is that even if someone goes for every achievement and story outcome, the average amount of time to accomplish this is around 15-20 hours, depending on whether you get help from walkthroughs or not. I think most people can agree that more gameplay time is preferable. However, I'd like to say that this is the ONLY flaw of this game (obviously, that's just my opinion though).

If you like visual novels, I highly recommend this one. Every single choice affects the ending of the story. There are also about a dozen different story ending combinations to be made. As the description of the game states, it is an adult version of the Cinderella story. However, Cinders (her name in this version) doesn't have to be the traditional character she's known to be. She can be villainous, independent, strong-willed, ambitious, etc. She can have whatever type of personality you want her to have. The best part is that she doesn't have to go after the prince. She can plot revenge against her stepmother and stepsisters, unlike the traditional character. She can be absolutely defiant and rebellious, also unlike the traditional character. But let's say you want her to be a nice, good person, but still establish her independence (from the Prince and her stepfamily), you can do that combination as well! Point being, this doesn't have to be the typical Cinderella story unless you want it to be. The story and the character are what you make it and for a visual novel, that's the best a gamer can ask for. 

Other good things about the game:
- The artwork is beautiful (and sort of gothic).
- The music is well-done and fitting to the atmosphere of the game.
- There are other suitors Cinders can go for other than the Prince.
- The gamer can see the point of view/character development of the stepsisters/stepmother if they wish to (making them more human than the original story).
- The game truly causes the gamer to put thought into the choices they make. 

I'll say it again: if you like visual novels, I HIGHLY recommend this game.

10966031.review:
Um ótimo ogo! Para quem curte visual novel, essa releitura do conto da cinderela é imperdível!
De acordo com o que você escolher, sua história vai mudando, podendo chegar a finais diferentes, e relacionamentos diferentes entre os personagens e Cinders, a figura principal da história.

Além disso, é interessante notar como a tela do menu principal muda, após o término da história, com as conquistas obtidas ingame!

Recomendado!

10909355.review:
I just wrote my own alternate story of Cinderella, truly amazing narration and characters. Even relationships with your sisters depends on your decisions through the game.
Feels like interactive book of fairytales, full of colourful pictures and hearthwarming design, which will never leave you indifferent.

10907287.review: Очень красивая визуальная новелла с интересным сюжетом (вольная трактовка "Золушки") и проработанными персонажами. Есть несколько концовок и множество моментов в игре, где нужно совершать выбор, имеющий последствия дальше по сюжету. В игре очень хорошо показано, что в окружающем мире часто нельзя все делить на явно черное или белое, и все люди имеют свои мотивы, которые при желании можно понять и разделить.

10893873.review: I liked Cinders from the very begining. I was drawn to it just from the image Steam gives you to click on. The trailer was really cool and I was BLOWN. AWAY. less than I minute into the game. I'm only in the middle of my first playthrough but the art is absolutely MIND BLOWING, there are a TON of interesting, unique little details, the story drew me in (and will more than likely do the same to you) and the characters are WONDERFFUL. It's done visual novel style, but even if you absolutely HATE visual novels this is still something you should check out!

10886553.review:
Although it is a retelling of the classic fairytale Cinderella, the new approach makes it seem like another story altogether.

Genre: Fantasy/Adventure
Duration: 2 to 3 hours for one ending; 10 to 15 hours for all endings.
Developed by: MoaCube, 2012

By playing as the namesake protagonist, you are introduced to a fantasy world in which you must deal with your stepmother and stepsisters at first, later meeting nobility, fairies, salesmen and townsfolk. You do so through choices and map movement intermissions in the narrative. So as not to leave you confused, the game flashes a wooden branch icon on the upper right corner of the screen everytime a previous choice is showing its consequence.

Cinders is structured so as to give your choices an aspect of freedom: there are not correct choices and you will always reach a satisfying ending that reflects your behaviour throughout the story. This means one single playthrough will last for about two hours, but one ending is just a glimpse of the stories Cinders has to offer.

The greatest strength this visual novel has is probably its characters: no character is completely redeemed nor degraded. They are complex, round characters with motivations and goals that you can relate yourself to, enhancing the moral aspect of the choices: each and every character has a lot to be explored, making for a consistent world with strong characters - and many strong female characters - and a sense that you are free to make your own judgement. 

This groundedness, however, doesn't stop the game from sporting a most pleasant fairytale atmosphere. The art and the music, through coherent design and stylistic choices, gives Cinders a fine identity and a unique feel down to minute details, such as small animations on the background and on the sprites. As such, it's easy to get used to the art style even if it's not commonly used in visual novels. Such attention to identity helps in the establshment of an emotional link between you and Cinders' world.

If only fow how bold it is, Cinders is a must for anyone who appreciates story-driven experiences with complex characters and a lot of room for the player to decide what happens next.

Positive:

*Great fairytale impression
*Many choices and many endings
*Fleshed out characters
*Music is comfortable to listen to and the sound design is adequate
*Consistent art and world

Negative:

*Short playthroughs. You might not feel the need to see other endings/epilogues
*Though the game shows when a choice is reflected on the progress of the story, some choices are still lost in perspective
*It's expensive

10882435.review: Amazing visual novel done by an indie developer team MoaCube, featuring beautiful artwork done by Gracjana Zielińska :) It plays very well - it has multiple endings and story lines. Even if you aren't a visual novel fan, you should pick up Cinders.

10869850.review:
Логичная и опрятно написанная визуальная новелла с интересной идеей - не переписать старую сказку на новый лад, а, скорее, дополнить ее прекрасно раскрытыми персонажами, каждый из которых теперь представляет собой не сказочно гипербалистическое зло или добро, а вполне себе человеческое существо со своими мотивами и представлениями о жизни. Мачеха тут "зла", но также и справедлива, сестры замкнуты в бесконечном цикле исполнения общественных желаний, растворяя в них свои личностные качества, а принц так и вообще хочет добиться реформ и гражданского общества, прорываясь сквозь паутину интриг и традиций.

В итоге, вроде, получается то же самое, что и в сказке, но осадок совершенно другой.

Рекомендую тем, у кого среднее знание английского и у кого нет аллергии к затянутым диалогам с выяснением отношений.

10853991.review: It is a fantastic choice-based visual novel based around the fairytale of Cinderella. The art is simply amazing and there are so many different endings and possibilities.

10794060.review:
A little gem of a visual novel with fairy tale roots. The art is gorgeous and the writing is usually good, although sometimes dialogue slips into unintentional hilarity. The writers seem hell-bent in impressing us with Cinders' insight, so occasionally the dialogue reminded me of a psychiatrist consulting a patient as Cinders clinically analyzes and solves (or abuses, depending on player choice) her stepsister's insecurities. 

As far as faults go, there are a few typos -  somewhat jarring in a text-based visual novel. A definite thumbs-up overall, though.

10761817.review: I dig it.  Slow, but chock full of story.

10708578.review: Nie nazwałbym tego grą, raczej klikana opowieść w której użytkownik wybiera dialogi. Wizualnie prezentuje się świetnie. Jeżeli ktoś dobrze odnajduje się w baśniowych klimatach, to powinien sprawdzić ten tytuł.

10701963.review:
When I started Cinders I wasn't sure I liked it, next thing I know I'm checking my watch and two hours have gone past!

Overall the story/writing is exceptional, it fleshes out characters that have motives and aspirations. My only complaint about the game is that, at points, the writing quality drops. For instance everybody always seems to be apologizing at the end of a conversation when there doesn’t seem to be a need to.

Each scene looks beautiful with colour and animations. You could stare at it for a very long time.

This game probably isn’t for everyone but if you enjoyed story driven games, like the ‘The Wolf Among us’ you’ll love this.

10688683.review:
I've only gotten one ending so far, but this is definitely one of the best games I've purchased on Steam and probably even one of the best games I've played all year. I was intrigued by the synopsis on the game's page, and it definitely lives up to all the lofty goals its set for itself. 

This game isn't just a spin on Cinderella - it's much more than that. The story seems to take a lot of interesting turns no matter what you want the outcome to be. The variations on endings depending on the choices you make is really cool; I wish more games used a system like it. But, even with an interesting story, this game may have been pretty bland if the characters were just ripped from the fairy tale. Luckily, that's not the case. All of the characters are more than they appear at first glance; they all have well-defined, complex personalities.

I would have gladly paid full-price for this game, and I am definitely going to explore it more.

10687931.review:
Talk about a sleeper hit (if games can be called that) - came across this at random during the Summer Sale and OMG! It is such a beautiful, well crafted, unique choose your own adventure take on the story of Cinderella. I'm in love with this game. Everyone should play it!

(Just ignore the occasional typos)

10643806.review: A fantastic visual novel where the story will change every time you play it based on the numerous decisions you can make. Almost every character is well-developed and well-rounded. No one's a purely perfect or despicable person; you learn more about them by making certain story choices. One of the best takes on Cinderella I've seen in a while. The beautiful artwork doesn't hurt.

10546236.review:
An excellent visual novel with an interesting re-imagining of the Cinderella fairytale. The story's short, but it does give you plenty of chances to alter the way that story unfolds. And however short it may be, the story really cannot be complimented enough for its quality. There aren't any CGs, which is to say unique graphics illustrating special moments, but the general artwork is more than good enough to make up for that.

All in all, if you're a fan of visual novels, this is definitely worth playing. If you've never played a visual novel before, this is an excellent choice for your first.

10537201.review:
Wer Visual Novel & Co mag, wird hier definitiv bedient werden, immerhin sieht man selten einen derart aufwändig gestalteten Hintergrund, bei dem sich jedes noch so kleine Blatt und Staubkorn zu bewegen scheint. Auch die Musik ist immerzu stimmig - ebenso, wie die verschiedenen Routen für sich. 
Es ist interessant, das Märchen mal ein wenig anders beleuchtet unter die Lupe zu nehmen und dabei mit einer unglaublichen Fülle an Entscheidungen konfrontiert zu werden.

10524689.review: It is bold to create an original game based on such a timeless tale, but Cinders is nevertheless successful. The dialogues are witty and the artwork is easy on the eye. This visual novel also goes deeper than typical "girly" ones, as not everything is all about being "liked" by a romantic interest or another, but also understand the people evolving around you, because, maybe even the evil step-mother actually has goals and aspirations that might not be that far from yours.

10521196.review: I've only been playing for a while and this is very entertaining. The writing and personality of the characters are amazing. I might be making choices that I would have made in reality but the way the story takes that is very very interesting indeed.

10516488.review:
Chi avrebbe mai detto che la storia di Cenerentola sarebbe stata ancora in grado di stupirmi nel 2014? Eppure il lavoro di MoaCube riesce nell’impresa di stupire nonostante parta proprio da una delle più classiche fiabe popolari. La storia della giovane ragazza schiavizzata dalla sua matrigna ha una tradizione antichissima, tanto che le sue primissime versioni arrivano sia dall’Egitto dei Faraoni che dalla Cina imperiale. Il grande successo arrivò con la rivisitazione da parte dei celeberrimi fratelli Grimm e grazie al conseguente adattamento cinematografico d’animazione a firma Disney.

MoaCube, un collettivo indie inizialmente creato da due polacchi ma ora aperto a collaborazioni da tutto il mondo, si era fin’ora misurata con RPG tattici, roguelike e shooter, ma mai con una visual novel, genere decisamente orientale che negli ultimi anni ha saputo raccogliere alcuni appassionati anche in occidente. Vi avevo già parlato di un’altra strana visual novel occidentale che giocava a mischiarsi con un puzzle-game, Unhack, tuttavia in Cinders ogni cosa è tesa per riportarci un’esperienza di gioco più classica ma non per questo meno interessante e varia. Tutto parte da una rivisitazione totale dell’universo classico di Cenerentola, inserito nel tipico contesto di “novelle interattive”.

Leggi la recensione completa su TheShelterNetwork: http://theshelternetwork.com/cinders-2/

10348717.review: This is pretty much as good as VNs get, and highly recommended if you like them or if you just want a modern, feminist and grown-up take on a classic fairy-tale. Cinders offers a lot of options and a wide variety of different endings. It also has good writing, and a fantastic score and art. I've achieved all the endings and they're all quite satisfactory (even when they're sad). Highly recommended and you'll get a lot of game-play out of this VN!

10346138.review: This was a horrible game with very old graphics.  Steam ssys release date is in 2014 but the graphics are like games from the 1980's.  I feel I was  misled. I believe they should put the true dates the games were released, this is false advertisement. 10230743.review:
I highly recommend Cinders.  This game / interactive novel brings back memories of R.L. Stine-esque books where you choose your own adventure.  Great story, lots of fun and beautiful story art.

10194041.review: I normally make it a rule not to spend more on a game than $1 per hour. 10088308.review:
Cinders is a realistic retelling of the classic Cinderella story. It's like a visual novel with a whole lot of reading (obviously), but it also gives you a choice from time to time. Choices that affect the story. As a result there are several endings to be unlocked, and a single playthrough can take anywhere between 3-5 hours I think. The art is done remarkably well, even if the faces lack of bit of character and the whole thing feels very polished. Except for a few typos, that is. 

I would recommend it to everyone who knows the story or just likes reading. But please note that it's not so much a game, but more of an interactive book. There's very little input required. And let's not forget about the price which is absurdly high. So for now I suggest waiting for a sale.

[Rating: 73/100]

10056562.review:
Basic Premise: Shape Cinderella’s character, attitude, and reactions to her upbringing and choose how she escapes. The many character trait and action choices that actually impact the story’s end make this visual novel stand out. I’ve played through it several times and still have not found all the paths.

Music: Most visual novels’ and sims’ soundtracks have me hunting for the mute button, but this one is gorgeous.

Visuals: Gracjana Zielinska’s art has a detailed, ethereal quality without becoming prissy or cutesy.  It’s beautiful.  I’m so pleased she’s returning for Solstice.

Programming: I appreciate the ability to quickly skip through already viewed scenes with one button press.  All visual novels should implement this.

Writing: *thunk**thunk* *thunk*  That noise, dear friend, is the characters’ dialog and the insights into their behavior being delivered with all the subtlety of a frying pan to the back of the skull. The reader is never left to infer anything. Cinders’ inner monologue or other characters will spell it out. During the first long conversation between Cinders and Sophia, they tell their back-story and motivations to one another without the reservation and self-protection that the back-story would naturally have bred.  It drove me crazy until I remembered Dostoevsky’s The Brothers Karamazov. Yes, the two works don’t seem to have much in common but bear with me. Like Karazmov, Cinders uses characters to represent a consistent type of person rather than how you and I would interact on a day-to-day basis. Once you go with it, they both deliver a good story and observations on human nature.  Boom. A 2012 visual novel saved by Dostoevsky.

Writing: The banter between characters usually makes me smirk (Sophia and Gloria should have their own spin-off). The only exception is the romantic dialog. Excuse me for a moment, game, while I fetch some nachos to go with all this cheese. Fortunately, the game has many endings with no romance whatsoever.

Writing: The grammar, spelling, and word choice are nearly perfect. Kudos to the editor.

Female Characters: The writers clearly spent more of their effort developing the women. Cinders, Carmosa, Gloria, Sophia, and Madame Ghede all have distinct personalities and goals. Sophia’s snark is always welcome: “The only things missing from this picture is holding hands and singing. And dancing. Possibly in circles. In the middle of a flowery meadow. I think I might throw up.” I want an ending in which she and Cinders escape together.

Male Characters: The men aren’t bad, but they lack the depth and care the women received. I won’t dwell on them (particularly since the developer has already addressed this), but here’s a brief run-down.  Tobias is a childhood friend who tends to deliver motivation speaker advice with the aforementioned frying pan; I want to like you, Toby, but you have to stop thwacking me over the head.  Perrault is a guard captain caught between duty and ethics; he is my favorite of the three.  Prince Basile is he least developed of the three, though the conversations between him and Perrault are good. He and Cinders discuss Levia Malich’s work in a scene ripped straight from Ever After, but other than that I enjoy their interactions.

Bottom Line: I recommend this to anyone (not just women) who wants a strong, competent protagonist and enjoys tinkering to discover different endings. If you happen to have a snarky sense of humor, even better.

10047056.review:
What initially drew me to Cinders was the combination of the female protagonist, visual novel category, and the lovely artwork. From the looks of it, Cinders seemed like it would be a wonderful game, and it definitely delivered! I just started my second playthrough, and I have been loving every minute of gameplay.

First, I absolutely must rave about the gorgeous art by Gracjana Zielinska! The character designs were unique and stunning, and the backgrounds were lavish and interesting. I loved how little details would appear or move in the background - that gave the graphics a "little something" extra to catch the eye! I could not get enough of the beautiful visuals and tried to research if she had done work on other games. I found out about Solstice, a mystery thriller visual novel coming soon, and Phantasmat, a hidden objects game. I am much more into visual novels, but the artwork alone is compelling me to give Phantasmat a chance also!

Second, the gameplay placed player choice front and center, and especially in a visual novel, I appreciated this greatly. Choices were frequent and truly affected the story; the "Rewards" section from the game's menu lets you see how many of the variants you've explored to the ending, and in my ending, I've only explored 25% so far, so there is still a lot for me to experience! I did do some saving/loading to see what would happen with certain choices and was very pleased with the level of difference I discovered. In addition, certain choices add adornments to the menu page - this made game progress even more exciting because I wanted to see what else would be added where. :) ... and it brought out the completionist in me! I am excited to unlock all the endings and as many variants as I can.

Third, the characters were unpredictably rich. Coming into a fairytale-inspired game, I expected the same character tropes, but while the characters were similarly-situated, they were far deeper than the superficial Cindarella cast I was used to! Cinders, for example, can be played to be quite pragmatic, or pig-headed, or honest, or devious, or a mix of the aforementioned, and based on my ending, I think the choice of these traits truly affects the outcome of the game. Madame Ghede was a favorite character of mine - I wanted to know so much more about her! She was enigmatic and wise, revealing a hint of the effects of what seemed to me a very detailed life. The stepmother (Carmosa) and step-sisters (Sophia and Gloria) were also multi-faceted, and there was more than meets the eye to Captain Perrault, as well.

The game's soundtrack suited it perfectly -- it was not overbearing, but rather complementary. Chimes indicated decisions, and subtle pieces (like at the Lake) would round out an enchanting experience. I wish the soundtrack had been included in a bundle because it would be a wonderful way to relax. :)

If you like visual novels, female protagonists, gorgeous artwork, fairytales, lots of choice that affects the ending, and a hint of romance, I highly recommend this game. If you adore Gracjana Zielinska's artwork (like I now do), you should also check out the upcoming visual novel from the same developer (Moacube) Solstice and the hidden objects game from Big Fish, Phantasmat. Enjoy!

10028372.review:
This interactive adventure caught my interest, initially because it did not have manga graphics; 
It has enough different choices to provide for some different outcomes or at least tweaks/versions of the handful of coded outcomes; the storyline is overall romance driven. 
Situations and consequences end up lacking some shades of grey, but then, which choice based game is not a bit black and white? Whether you like fairy tales that blossom in royal weddings, hopeless romances that overcome social judgement and class differences, arranged marriages brewed in cynical logics and fueled by a drive for advancement, you are likely to find a natural flow of answers that fit your virtual inclination. 
There is replayability to satisfy curiosity, though it comes encumbered by some medium lengths carved in stone events and dialogues, so that will eventually dry out. 
For the time curiosity lasts, a very enjoyable chose your path game, well worth a first try and a couple more run throughs.

So why play this game?: you d like to see the face of the cinderella in you who does not speak her name.

10022046.review:
There’s many things that I like about this game so I’ll do a list:

>>>GENERAL STUFF:
-The art gorgeous. There are even small background animations as well which makes the scenes livelier. I’m so in love with the art is almost hurts!

-If we make a decision and it affects the story differently, a flower appears on the top right of the screen. It’s kind of like the Walking Dead’s “____ will remember that”. Personally, I like the instant feedback on my decisions.

-The dialouge between characters can feel a little stiff and awkward at times. Maybe it's because the characters aren't that close with each other and that's why it gives off that vibe.

-I love how when we get achievements, the title screen updates and things are added as we discover more things. What in the jellybeans, that’s AMAZING!

-The music is gorgeous. There are times when I stop and listen and go “whoa!” one of the conversations got pretty tense and the music followed suit.

-I like the attention to detail when the words roll onto the screen. It is as if each word was cast into existence by a small fairy as little colourful sparks burst behind every appearing word.

We know when a person is speaking hurriedly, maybe even angrily since the text appears very quickly. When words are spoken by characters with emphasis, the text emerges slowly, and there are pauses at key moments to create tension. I’m usually the type of person who clicks twice to see all the text appear all at once since I’m an impatient reader, but Cinders has made me stop and enjoy watching the text tap happily along the screen.



>>>STORY:
-The story has a lot of variations (player choices and endings). One ending may have small, but still significant changes that shows up in the epilogue depending on the choices we made.

-There is a convenient skip option as well so there isn’t a big pain when replaying for different possibilities.

-I personally loved bonding with Cinder’s sisters. I love them and easily got attached to them, problems, flaws and all. If we bond with them a certain way, they react differently to us, differently to others, and maybe even towards themselves.


>>>OVERALL:
It’s a great game, with a great story, amazing music, stunning art, and the list goes on! It allows us to make choices as we read making us more invested. There are many paths and endings to discover.

You may not be too into it if you’re not a big reading fan. But if you enjoy reading or visual novels, Cinders is a MUST GET! Even if you aren’t into visual novels, give this one a go, maybe your tastes will change! There is a demo on their main site to try out at MoaCube.

10019219.review: To few of these games out there. Excellent is all I can say.

10004246.review:
I'm really interested in visual novels, particularly ones aimed at women, so I've been trying to make a point of everything available in English. I have to say, this is probably the best one I've seen so far.

The aesthetics of this game are amazing. The art is beautiful, as you can see from the screenshots, but something they don't show is how everything looks in movement. The backgrounds are subtly animated and the text appears on the screen in a magical shine of color. It's mostly small touches, but it makes the game feel very unique from a lot of other indie visual novels that originally came out in English.

Another thing that makes Cinders really stand out is the way they show you how your choices are affecting the game. Every time a line is changed due to one of your choices, a chime plays and a symbol appears in the corner. Once you reach certain goals (which you gain achievements for on Steam) the starting menu will change to show your awards. And after you reach an ending, there's a screen that shows you all the possible variables in the ending you achieved. I'm impressed to see that it looks like there's a LOT of variables in the ending I got, which makes me really interested in what other possibilities there are! (It should also help the game have lots of value as well--my first playthrough was probably around three hours or so, so I'm expecting to get a good amount of playtime in to complete all the endings and branching paths...10-15 hours is what I'm estimating right now.) 

I was also impressed by the number of choices present in the game--they happen frequently, and never feel pointlessly shoved in. I don't know how well the illusion of choice will hold up in further playthroughs but at least in this first one I really felt like my choices had an impact, which makes me very pleased.

As for the story--I loved it. Nearly all of the characters are interesting and have different layers to uncover from what I've seen in the game so far. I particularly like what's been done with the stepsisters--the game doesn't quite make excuses for them, but does a lot to make it make sense why they'd be so cruel to Cinders. Finding out more about Sophia in particular (who is probably my favorite character) is something I'm looking forward to trying to uncover in later playthroughs.

If I had one complaint, the only thing I could come up with is that at times the game's dialogue clashes with the tone they seem to be going for. They're trying to make the story feel like it's in a historical place--one where there are elements of fantasy, but that could otherwise reasonably exist at some point in history. But a lot of the dialogue feels oddly modern and even occasionally slang-y. I don't think this is exactly a problem, but it does clash at times with their attempts to make things feel 'historical.' 

But honestly, that's a nitpick, and one I gave partially so this review wouldn't be completely glowing. Otherwise, this is probably the best Visual Novel I've played, hands down. I'm glad it's finally showed up on Steam.
